title: Supervisor
description:
**\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*SHIFT SUPERVISOR - MUST BE OPEN TO RELOCATE\\*\\*\\*\\*\\***


Balcones Recycling East is a leader in the municipal recycling industry. Balcones Recycling was established in 2003 and soon became the cornerstone of the New York City curbside recycling program. In addition to NYC, Balcones Recycling now serves several NJ municipalities and counties, and in recent years has expanded operations to Florida. We are an operations-intensive business, processing large tonnages at multiple facilities, producing sorted commodities for the recycled materials market.


Balcones Recycling is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We value the diversity of all of our employees, and we are committed to creating a working environment that is built on a foundation of respect and inclusion, where everyone can contribute, advance on merit, and realize their full potential.

**We are currently looking for Shift Supervisors to join our facility in Brooklyn, NY with the ability to relocate to other facilities across North America.**

**Job Summary**


The Shift Supervisor is responsible for supervising and coordinating activities of workers engaged in operating machines that process (screen, sort, separate and bale) household recyclable materials (metal, glass and plastic).

**Major Job Responsibilities/Duties**

* Develop familiarity with an ensure compliance with safety, health, environment and community company policies and procedures as they pertain to facility operations and equipment usage and operation
* Observe sorting, equipment operation, processing and bailing operations
* Assign duties to workers according to production schedules and demonstrate safe, efficient use of equipment
* Inspect machinery and equipment to verify conformance to production standards
* Prepare time, attendance and production reports
* Ability to manage personnel (Approx. 25 employees) and lead by example
* Multi-task and willingness to learn all areas of operations
* Must be able to lead process and quality teams on improving workflow and quality
* Enter production data and other information on the computer
* Perform other duties as assigned

**Job Qualifications**

* **\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*SHIFT SUPERVISOR - MUST BE OPEN TO RELOCATE\\*\\*\\*\\*\\***
* High school diploma or general education degree (GED) or equivalent business experience required
* Previous supervisory skills in a diverse, fast-paced manufacturing/production environment
* Excellent mechanical ability and strong analytical skills
* Demonstrated ability to follow procedures and work from a set of written instructions
* Ability to work in a plant processing environment for extended periods of time
* Flexibility required to work successfully on a team
* Active individual who will be comfortable spending most of the day walking
* Basic computer skills
* Good time management and multi-tasking ability
* Must speak and understand English; Spanish speaking is a plus

  

**Working conditions/physical demands**

*The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to stand and reach with hands and arms. The employee is frequently required to walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; climb or balance and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee is occasionally required to sit and talk or hear. The employee must regularly lift and /or move up to 25 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.*

*While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly exposed to moving mechanical parts; and outside weather conditions. The employee is frequently exposed to high, precarious places and vibration. The noise level in the work environment is usually loud.*

**Additional Comments**


Disclaimer: The above statements are statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, skills.


With a promote-from-within philosophy and a variety of programs available to support continuous learning, Balcones Recycling offers the opportunity for a rewarding career. We are committed to the ecologically sound and sustainable use of resources and strive to operate in a manner that minimizes waste and protects the environment.


A career with Balcones Recycling provides you with the opportunity to work with an organization whose goal is to be the world’s safest and most responsible recycling company. Our people achieve this by creating a zero-harm workplace, being exemplary members of the communities in which we operate and being responsible stewards of the environment. We also offer competitive pay and a range of attractive benefits.


Find Out More…


Please visit Balcones Resources - Sustainable Future Through Recycling (balconesrecycling.com) for more information on Balcones Recycling and its commitment to sustainability.


BALCONES RECYCLING IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. THE COMPANY DOES NOT DISCRIMINATE WITH REGARD TO RACE, SEX, RELIGION, COLOR, NATIONAL ORIGIN, CITIZENSHIP STATUS, DISABILITY, AGE, MARITAL OR FAMILIAL STATUS, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, GENDER IDENTITY, GENDER EXPRESSION, VETERAN STATUS, HOUSING STATUS, SOURCE OF INCOME, OR ANY OTHER STATUS PROTECTED BY FEDERAL, STATE, OR LOCAL LAWS. THIS APPLIES TO ANY EMPLOYMENT DECISION, INCLUDING RECRUITING, HIRING, PLACEMENT, PROMOTION, TERMINATION, LAYOFF, RECALL, TRANSFER, LEAVES OF ABSENCE, COMPENSATION, AND TRAINING. QUALIFIED APPLICANTS WITH A DISABILITY IN NEED OF A REASONABLE ACCOMMODATION MAY REQUEST SUCH WITHOUT FEAR OF REPRISAL OR DISCRIMINATION.

  

Job Type: Full-time


Pay: $70,000/annually


Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Dental insurance
* Vision insurance
* HSA/ FSA
* Paid time off
* Employee Assistance Program

* Tuition Reimbursement

* Ability to relocate to other facilities across North America

* Microsoft Office: 2 years (Preferred)

Century Fasteners Corporation, established in 1955, is an international master distributor of fasteners and non-fastener products, including military, aerospace, commercial, and electronic components, representing premier manufacturers in the industry. We have multiple locations throughout the United States with our corporate headquarters located in Elmhurst, NY. Concentrating our priority on customer service, we have obtained a stellar reputation within the industry. That reputation is built by our greatest asset…our employees. Due to our continued growth and success, we are currently seeking an Inventory Clerk to join our team.

Independently manages Century Fasteners Corp. off-site warehouse on customer premises. Receives, maintains, and distributes required material to customer production areas. Will work closely with an Account Manager, or Branch Manager to satisfy customer production needs.

title: Transport Driver
description:
*Paraco seeks a loyal, responsible, dedicated, customer-oriented Class A Driver who will join our professional transportation team performing Northeast regional Bulk Transport and Production Cylinder Transport.*

 **Position Summary**: The Bulk Transport Driver is primarily responsible for picking up propane at various supply points and delivering the product to Paraco owned facilities or Paraco customer facilities. Work may include picking up and delivering refurbished tanks on box or flatbed trailer. In addition, this position may also assist in servicing vehicles and assorted repairs of transport equipment. This position is responsible for providing outstanding customer service and adhering to industry safety standards.  

  

**Key responsibilities and essential job functions include, but are not limited to:**  

  

* Provide safe, punctual, consistent and reliable deliveries of bulk and cylinder propane on a daily basis.
* Participate in and complete all required industry compliance and company training.
* Provide consistent courteous and efficient customer service.
* Perform necessary vehicle and trailer inspections as required.
* Ensure Daily Vehicle Inspection is performed.
* Special projects and other duties as assigned.

  

**Desired skills and experience:**  

  

* A minimum of one-year Class A CDL experience preferably in delivery of bulk propane, fuel oil or other hazardous materials.
* A current valid CDL license which must contain valid Hazardous Materials (H) and Tank Vehicle (N) endorsements.


o An (X) combination endorsement may be substituted for an (H) and (N) endorsement.  

o License may not contain any Air Brakes (L) or (Z) Restriction(s).  

o Clean and safe driving record in full compliance with all DOT licensing requirements.  

* A Safe driving record.
* Willingness to work outdoors in all weather and driving conditions.
* Mechanically inclined skills (preferred but not required):


o Experience with hand tools, power tools and test equipment.  

o Basic troubleshooting, problem solving and diagnostic skills.  

* High School Diploma or GED equivalent.
* Must be able to lift and carry up to 75 pounds at times throughout the day as well as bend, climb, reach, & rotate as needed. Also must be able to pull up to a 175 ft. delivery hose through various terrains and during changing weather conditions.
* Strong team player with excellent communication and interpersonal skills is essential.
* Must be a detail-oriented self-starter with the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
* The work week is Monday to Friday with some Saturday / Sunday shifts as needed due to demand. Hours will vary depending upon location and the needs of the business. (We seek drivers with shift flexibility occasional overtime and on-call assignments as needed).
* Availability during Holidays as per the Company Schedule.
* Vacation blackout dates may apply.
 **Paraco Gas**  

Corporation is the largest privately held propane marketer in the Northeast. As a local, family-owned company with 50 years of experience in the propane industry, we are proud to be recognized as the 10th largest propane retailer and 2nd largest independent marketer of propane nationally (LP Gas Magazine Survey 2019). By putting customers first in everything we do, our professional services team, our extensive fleet and our unparalleled supply availability enable Paraco Gas to be an energy services leader.

 *Paraco Gas proudly offers our colleagues exceptional benefits including but not limited to medical, Rx, Vision and Dental, a 401(k) plan with company match, paid time off, company holidays, tuition reimbursement, uniforms, propane discounts, zero-cost DOT Physical Examinations & more.*
company_description: Joining Paraco means you will be part of a growing company thriving in a highly entrepreneurial, fast-paced culture. Fueling Your Every Day

title: ASSISTANT MERCHANT II - FOOTWEAR
description:
**FULLBEAUTY Brands™** is the premier fashion and lifestyle destination for the plus size customer. We are an online and catalog marketplace offering a curated collection of the finest family of plus size brands and thousands of products. **POSITION SUMMARY:**
The Assistant Merchant II will be responsible for assisting in all phases of product selection for their designated brand/product category. The Assistant Merchant II will work alongside the Merchant/Senior Merchant to influence the product development process. They will be expected to incorporate competitive shopping analysis and previous seasons KPIs to make recommendations for their designated product category. **PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:*** Create, track and update sample management lists
* Set up sample items in advance of merchant meetings or on as needed basis
* Support the Merchandise Manager/Senior Merchandise Manager in all phases of product selection and development for both catalog and web
* Interact daily with cross-functional teams to coordinate merchandising objectives and support collaboration
* Conduct competitive research by shopping catalog and retail competition to identify key items and trends
* Pull reports of business results and analyze Key Performance Indicators to make recommendations for future seasons
* Support Merchandise Manager/Senior Merchandise Manager on transversal responsibilities for merchandising team as needed.
* Assist in assorting books in line with launch and promo strategy.
* Review current and previous history to make suggestions and changes to drive sales ensuring sales are maximized.

**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:*** Bachelor’s degree in fashion merchandising or a related field
* 2-3 years of merchandising or product related experience required
* Footwear experience a plus
* Ability to multitask required
* Strong communication and follow up skills required
* Detail orientation and organizational skills a must
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) is a must

**WHY JOIN FULLBEAUTY?**

* Competitive Health Benefits (Medical, Dental & Vision)
* Employer HSA Contribution
* 401K Match
* Employee Assistance Program
* Hybrid Work Schedule (Corporate)
* Business Casual Attire
* Wellness Initiatives
* 30% Associate Merchandise Discount Across our Family of Brands
* Employee Discount on Travel, Cell Phone Plans and More
* Generous Paid Time Off Program
* Promote From Within Culture
* Commitment to Being an Equal Opportunity Employer
* Life Insurance Benefits
* Internal charity that supports FULLBEAUTY Brands’ associates and their immediate family members during times of extreme hardship

 **FULLBEAUTY Brands™** is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

title: Peer Specialist - Clinic
description:
**RiseWell Community Services is seeking a Full-time Peer Specialist to join the clinical team at the Wyandanch Clinic**

**REPORTS TO:** Team Leader  
**DEPARTMENT:** Clinical Services

**HOURS:** 35 hours per week

Valid NYS Peer Counselor Certification with minimum 1 years of experience providing services to individuals with Mental Health, Substance Use, or Physical Health needs. Experience within a treatment and rehabilitation setting Valid and clean NY State driver license, fingerprinting, criminal record check, and approval from NYS required.

**JOB FUNCTION:** 

Provide evidence-based services rooted in lived experience with a focus on integrated mental health, physical health, and substance use recovery. Services will be provided by a multi-disciplinary treatment team with an overall goal to improve consumer health outcomes. A caseload of adults, children, and families will be maintained while providing individual, group, and family sessions.

**BENEFITS INCLUDE:**

* Comprehensive Medical/Dental/Vision
* Retirement 401K Savings Plan with Employer Match
* Generous Paid Time Off for Full-time and Eligible Part-Time Employees
* 13 paid Holidays for Full-time and Eligible Part-Time Employees
* Long and Short Term Disability
* Life Insurance
* Employee Assistance Program
* CALM App Subscription
* Flexible Work Schedules
* Career Growth & Promotional Opportunities
* Comprehensive Paid Training
* Supplemental Accident, Illness and Hospitalization Insurance
* Supplemental Pet Insurance
* Encouragement for Educational Professional Advancement
* Employee Perks & Discounts on Broadway shows, theme parks, and other attractions
* Eligibility for Federal/Public Loan Forgiveness

**EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER:**  
RiseWell provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

**About Us:**  
RiseWell Community Services (RiseWell) is a multi-service, community-based social wellness agency and is a major provider of health and wellness, senior & children’s services, housing, and support services in Suffolk, Nassau, Queens, Brooklyn, Bronx and Manhattan. Originally comprised of an alliance of family advocacy groups, RiseWell Community Services was incorporated as a not-for-profit in 1972. For fifty years, RiseWell has developed innovative, successful programs that are designed to meet the needs of vulnerable populations, such as individuals in recovery, those living with chronic medical conditions, adult home residents, the homeless, low-income seniors and at-risk children. Since 1977, RiseWell’s mission has been to engage people with disabilities in community service and provide a wide range of programs including care coordination, housing, clinical treatment, employment, peer advocacy, and other rehabilitative services. One of RiseWell’s main goals is to improve the lives of people with disabilities and their families through education, information and referral services, legislative action and program development.

title: DSP (Direct Support Professional)
description:
**\\*\\*\\*NOW OFFERING A SIGNING BONUS -** **$500 FOR PART TIME, $1,000 FOR FULL TIME\\*\\*\\***

**Avidd Community Services of New Jersey, Inc** proudly serves people with intellectual and developmental disabilities in Bergen, Morris, Warren and Somerset Counties. Our residential programs are homes that are settled in various communities throughout suburban North Jersey. Each home is custom suited to its residents, their abilities, needs and personalities. Avidd strongly believes in fostering independence and teaching life skills.

**What We Are Looking For?**

We are currently hiring **Direct Support Professionals (DSPs)** for our residential group homes in Bergen County (Hackensack, Bogota, Englewood).

**Salary is based on education, experience, and previous training.**

**Role of a Direct Support Professional (DSP):**

· Attend to all personal care including but not limited to: toileting, dental hygiene (brushing and dental flossing if necessary), bathing, feeding etc; re-position, lift and transfer any individuals who utilize wheelchairs.

· Provide training for individuals in independent living skills.

· Supervise and assist in medications taken by individuals.

· Transport, assist and advocate on medical appointments.

· Supervise self-help skills of individuals, if necessary, provide least intrusive assistance.

· Initiate and follow through on leisure time activities.

· Assist individuals in nutritional food preparation.

· Supervise individuals with proper selection and care of clothing.

· Assist in maintaining the cleanliness of the home.

· Complete accurate documentation in the Electronic Health Record (Therap) on every shift.

· Provide necessary First Aid and CPR to individuals in need.

**Requirements:**

· Applicants must be caring, responsible, and reliable.

· Must have a willingness to undergo required pre-employment drug screening, fingerprinting, Child Abuse Record Information (CARI) application, Central Registry background check, physical/PPD testing, and training.

· Applicant must have a minimum of a high school diploma/GED and a valid driver's license (in good standing and not in probationary status).

**What Does Avidd Offer?**

· Full Time and Part Time Signing Bonuses

· Incentives for select locations

· Insurance Options (Medical with HSA, Dental, Vision) at great rates.

· Paid Training

· Paid Holidays- including 3 Floating Holidays

· Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) & Sick Time

· Employee Referral Bonus Program

· 403b Retirement Plan

· Flexible schedules

· Competitive wages with incentives for previous training and experience

**APPLY TODAY ON INDEED!**

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $16.88 - $19.88 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Weekends as needed

Application Question(s):

* Are you vaccinated for COVID-19? Have you received a booster?
* What days and shifts are you available to work?

* Driver's License in good standing (Required)

title: GRA APPE Student
description:
At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.



J&J Innovative Medicine Global Regulatory Affairs (GRA) is looking for high energy, inventive, self-starter pharmacy student for its 2024 Advanced Pharmacy Practice Experience (APPE) program. We offer an exciting immersive APPE experience for individuals who are passionate about exploring a career in healthcare. The purpose of this rotation is to expose the senior pharmacy student to the field of GRA covering pharmaceutical drug therapy development and product commercialization. Most importantly, this APPE rotation will provide students with an opportunity to work alongside a pharmacist providing meaningful input for the research & development of therapies.



What’s it like to be a Regulatory Affairs APPE Student?



Gain hands-on, real world experience and an overview of the pharmaceutical industry. Work on projects that improve your leadership, problem solving, and critical thinking skills. Network and gain cross-functional exposure. Experience regulatory areas including Product Labeling, Chemistry, Manufacturing and Controls, Policy and Intelligence. Work with knowledgeable mentors, develop skills, and build an understanding of how being in Regulatory Affairs impacts the development of medicinal treatments!



Potential growth opportunities during the APPE may include, but are not limited to::


* Work on programs and strategies for compounds in development and/or marketed products.
* Gain experience and exposure in drug development intended to address unmet medical needs in markets globally through an understanding of laws, guidances, and regulatory requirements for drugs and combination products.
* Partner with other regulatory colleagues with diverse skills and experiences in building solutions for real-life business challenges through hands-on projects.

  

  

**Qualifications**
------------------


* Currently pursuing an advanced degree in pharmacy (PharmD) from an approved, accredited academic institution.
* Demonstrated leadership in campus/community activities is desired.
* Able to work individually, as well as, part of a group, with curiosity and flexibility.
* Possess a “can do” approach, and courage to speak your voice and suggest innovative ideas.
* Available to work full-time (40 hours per week) during APPE rotation.


For additional general information on Company benefits, please go to: - https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits.

  

This job posting is anticipated to close on 08/28/2024. The Company may however extend this time-period, in which case the posting will remain available on https://www.careers.jnj.com to accept additional applications.

  

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

title: VP - Acquisitions & Divestitures, Tech
description:
Johnson & Johnson is recruiting for a Vice President of Acquisitions & Divestitures (A&D) within the Johnson & Johnson Technology (JJT) organization, based in New Brunswick, NJ. Reporting to the CIO of Corporate Business Technology, this key leadership role will be responsible for overseeing the A&D Program/Project Management group and driving global and regional deals. The VP will lead the resource plan, budget and multiple strategic A&D programs, while providing regular updates to senior leadership. The role requires collaboration with Deal Leads, Functional Leads, Architects, and Data Strategy teams to develop A&D strategies and ensure the successful integration and divestiture of programs.

  

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

  

Key Responsibilities:

  

* Collaborate with pre-close teams to capture and report deal activities across Business Development groups.
* Lead the overall A&D IT investment portfolio during the post-close phase of A&D programs.
* Maintain the post-close section of the portfolio tracker, issuing monthly progress reports to JJT senior leaders and the A&D Community of Practice.
* Raise critical issues to Deal Leaders or VP A&D when needed.
* Lead a team that provides program and project management services for acquisitions, divestitures, licensing, collaborations, and more.
* Develop short-term and long-term program management strategies tailored to deal characteristics.
* Build and refine program/project management capabilities, including planning, scheduling, managing critical paths, and maintaining program budgets.
* Lead the regional execution of global plans, as defined by Deal and Functional team leads, ensuring consistency across regions.
* Lead all aspects of the development, management, and execution of TSAs, ensuring they are properly organized, costed and implemented post-close.
* Identify, develop and nurture project management talent within the A&D organization.
* Train and coach high-potential candidates on the A&D process, incorporating them into the A&D organization on a rotational basis.
* Maintain and curate the program/project management portion of the JJT A&D Playbook, ensuring that it is up-to-date and that team members are trained on its contents.
* Identify and lead continuous improvement initiatives across the A&D organization, improving the efficiency and effectiveness of the program.
* Work closely with the pre-close team to ensure smooth transitions from pre-close to post-close phases.
* Assist Deal Leads in ensuring program structure and methodologies align with deal drivers and business objectives.
* Establish change management and communication efforts for deals, consolidating lessons learned for future application.

  

  

**Qualifications**
------------------


* Bachelor’s level degree or equivalent in a technology related field such as Computer Engineering, Computer Science or Information Technology. Master's level degree is preferred.
* Minimum of 15-years’ experience working within a technology related field
* Extensive experience in program and project management within the context of A&D, with a deep understanding of M&A processes and the role of various participants.
* Consistent track record in managing large, complex programs with multiple interdependencies.
* Strong background in developing and leading high-performing teams, with experience in agile methodologies.
* Strong leadership capabilities, with the ability to make decisive, data-driven decisions quickly.
* Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills, capable of explaining A&D technology strategies to business partners.
* Ability to thrive in highly ambiguous environments and facilitate cross-functional dialogues to resolve issues efficiently.
* Strong problem-solving skills and a bias towards execution and delivery.
* Demonstrated ability to model Credo values, building trust, transparency and effective solutions across business and IT functions.
* Dedicated to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment.
* Willingness to travel domestically and internationally up to 30%.

  

The anticipated base pay range for this position is $188,000 to $345,000.



The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis. · Please use the following language:


* Employees and/or eligible dependents may be eligible to participate in the following Company sponsored employee benefit programs: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, business accident insurance, and group legal insurance.
* Employees may be eligible to participate in the Company’s consolidated retirement plan (pension) and savings plan (401(k)).
* This position is eligible to participate in the Company’s long-term incentive program.
* Employees are eligible for the following time off benefits: - Vacation – up to 120 hours per calendar year
* Sick time - up to 40 hours per calendar year; for employees who reside in the State of Washington – up to 56 hours per calendar year
* Holiday pay, including Floating Holidays – up to 13 days per calendar year of Work, Personal and Family Time - up to 40 hours per calendar year

  

  

* Additional information can be found through the link below. https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits


The compensation and benefits information set forth in this posting applies to candidates hired in the United States. Candidates hired outside the United States will be eligible for compensation and benefits in accordance with their local market.

  

Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies are equal opportunity employers, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Head of Quality Management
description:
**Who we are:**

  

LANXESS is a leading specialty chemicals company with sales of EUR 6.7 billion in 2023. The company currently has about 12,800 employees in 32 countries. Our core business is the development, manufacturing and marketing of chemical intermediates, additives and consumer protection products. LANXESS is listed in the leading sustainability indices Dow Jones Sustainability Index (DJSI World and Europe) and FTSE4Good.


We are looking to find diverse and talented people to join our team. Studies have shown that some individuals are less likely to apply if they do not meet 100% of the criteria. We are looking to equalize the gap! If you are excited about this role but your past experiences do not align perfectly with every qualification, we encourage you to apply. We will look to assess your talent against our competencies, values and requirements to get the best organizational fit. You might be the right candidate for this or other roles we have available!


Join our Team!

**Job Description**
-------------------


The Head of Quality is responsible for managing, mentoring, and supervising the Quality Control and Quality Assurance departments. The position and associated reports work collaboratively cross functionally with other departments including but not limited to Operations and Plant Engineering and Maintenance to drive continuous improvement in quality, process, cost, efficiency, capacity and process safety.


**Job Highlights**
------------------

* The Head of Process Engineering and Quality position is a key site senior leadership position at the Lanxess-East Hanover site and oversees and is responsible for the following functional areas and departments at the site:
* Quality Assurance, and Quality Control.
* The position has in total approximately 8-10 total reports. Reports include the Plant Chemist and Laboratory Supervisor (which has reports of approximately 6 lab technicians and contract lab techs as needed)
* In terms of QC responsibilities, the position oversees all QC functions on site.
* The position manages the Laboratory Supervisor and associated QC laboratory and all technicians. Critical QC functions include but are not limited to testing of raw materials, intermediates, and finished products, and all associated documentation, managing resources, and special projects. Responsibilities include supporting manufacturing and helping troubleshoot causes and help resolve quality issues. The position will manage the laboratory supervisor who in turn manages laboratory technicians
* In terms of quality assurance (QA), the position is responsible for overseeing the site’s quality management system and that it is compliant, understood and effective. The position is responsible for maintaining all required certifications which include: ISO 9001:2015; RC14001; AS9100D, and special certifications such as UL and FM. The position is the management representative for quality on site and manages the site quality engineer (who is the principal resource to maintain the site’s QSM, certifications, and leads and/or participates in all quality related audits.
* The Head of Quality also manages the site chemist and directs activities to support manufacturing operations, formulation issues, as well as other special assignments.
* The position is customer facing and must be able to able to effectively communicate and present both internally as well as externally.
* The Head of Process Engineering and Quality must be able to provide performance feedback to team and coach others on how to promote positive employee relations through effective conflict management and issue resolution. They should be able to provide training opportunities for team and foster an environment for personal growth.
* He/She will ensure employee safety, provide leadership, coaching and accountability of all employees assigned to meet quality and production goals.
**Requirements**
----------------

* Education: Minimum of a Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Chemistry
* 5+ years: Leading and or supervising QA and QC departments
* Ability to lead, strategically plan and manage and direct others to achieve tactical execution.
* a strategic visionary with sound technical skills, analytical ability, good judgment and strong operational focus.
* skilled leader and coach
* strong communication skills and business acumen.
* Continuous improvement skills such as six sigma and root cause analysis experience (desired)
* Quality auditor experience (desired)
**What we offer you:**

* **Compensation:** We offer competitive compensation packages, inclusive of a global bonus program and an individual performance bonus program.
* **Comprehensive Benefits:** We provide a variety of benefits to support your financial security, health and wellbeing including retirement plans, health programs, life insurance and medical care.
* **Work-Life & Flexibility:** We support you in maintaining a balance between working hours and personal life. With our global “Xwork” program, we offer flexible working arrangements in all countries in which we operate.
* **Training & Development:** We are committed to your professional and personal development and encourage you in the ongoing pursuit of education, training and knowledge through both formal and informal learning.
* **Diversity:** LANXESS is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, age, social class, physical ability or attributes, religion, national origin, veteran status and political beliefs.

  

LANXESS has a value-based performance culture. We are seeking a range of human interests, backgrounds, and experiences that can be engaged to achieve respect, ownership, trust, professionalism, integrity and healing across all sectors.

  

  

Join the LANXESS team!
company_description: Ein dynamischer Konzern wie LANXESS braucht ein starkes Team. Gestalten Sie gemeinsam mit uns die Zukunft!

title: Physician Assistant/Nurse Practitioner Per-diem and Full Time
description:
Description:
**JOB SUMMARY**


The Physician Assistant / Nurse Practitioner (PA/NP) functions as a Sub-Investigator in support of the Division of Site Services in the provision of medical care and research assistance under the direction and supervision of the Clinical Research Unit Management. The PA/NP is responsible for providing clinical evaluation of potential research subjects and providing continuous monitoring throughout clinical subject participation in trials under the guidance of the Principal Investigator.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Serves as a Sub-Investigator on Clinical Trials as allowed by the sponsor and protocol.
* Obtains complete history of patients and research subjects, recording elements of past health history, family history, review of health habits, environmental and occupational data
* Conducts physical examination to provide information for use in diagnostic study and treatment of patients and research subjects; obtains and ships biological samples
* Records study information in the source documents and detailing all changes
* Maintains the accuracy and completeness of all patient records
* Oversees research assistants on the clinical unit and guides as needed
* Review daily phone screens & pre-screening documentation
* Assists in training of research assistants on performing clinical procedures
* Phase one study oversight includes study set-up, dosing, QC’ing charts, and data, and overseeing and assisting RAs/techs with study assessments.
* Review all protocols and other study-related materials and ensure compliance
* Assist research staff as needed, as well as other clinicians
* Other duties as assigned

  

Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and location. For NYC, the salary range is up to $65/hr.


Requirements:
* The position requires at least graduation from an accredited Physician Assistant / Nurse Practitioner program with registration
* Licensure in NY State and/or NJ State
* Must have interpersonal skills sufficient to effectively interact with patients and Clinilabs staff in fulfilling the duties and responsibilities of the position
* Preferred experience performing clinical procedures such as venipuncture, IV catheter insertion, etc.
* The PA/NP must have analytical abilities sufficient to interpret patient examination results and possess national certification as a Physician Assistant/ Nurse Practitioner as applicable.
company_description: Clinilabs Drug Development Corporation is a contract research organization (CRO) that provides clinical drug development services to industry.

title: Patient Coordinator
description:
Position Summary:


Our Patient Coordinators are the backbone of our clinics and have a direct impact on patient experience. title: 2024 Gala Support Staff (Per Diem)
description:
Description:
**JOB OVERVIEW**


Prospect Park Alliance seeks Event Support Staff (Per Diem) for the annual Gala taking place at the Prospect Park Carousel, working the Gala itself on Thursday, September 26 and the production period from Monday, September 23 through Saturday, September 28. The Event Support Staff will assist with event traffic control during event set up and break down, provide relevant information to park users regarding event and any impact affecting a specific area, and assist in ensuring producers adhere to all NYC Parks safety regulations.

**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS / KEY JOB OUTCOMES**

* Assist in coordinating traffic control and escort event related vehicles onsite;
* Assist park users crossing safely during vehicular movement;
* Communicate with park goers when required to inform them on any event related questions, or impact;
* Check event site where equipment is being setup to ensure minimal damage to area;
* Assist with general event/venue set-up and cleaning (gloves, pickers and brooms provided);
* Provide overnight onsite coverage when needed;
* Ability and willingness to stand for long periods of time (sunscreen will be available);
* Understanding that if production is ahead of schedule or behind schedule, per diems may be released early or may be asked to work additional hours; all hours partially worked (as directed by the Alliance) will be paid as full hours; minimum paid time will be four hours per shift.

*Performs other job-related duties and functions as assigned*


Requirements:
**EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE**

* High School Diploma or equivalent

**COMPETENCIES (Knowledge, Skills & Personal Attributes)**

* A passion for and commitment to the Alliance mission, sustaining the environment and the values of diversity, equity and inclusion
* Knowledge of principles and processes for providing superior customer service
* Highly interpersonal with an approachable and positive customer facing demeanor
* Ability to organize and prioritize work quickly and retain focus in a busy work environment.
* Ability to effectively communicate information and ideas in speaking and writing
* Skill in completing assignments accurately and with attention to detail
* Knowledge of cleaning techniques and procedures
* Proficient with automated technologies that support area of responsibility including G-Suite and Microsoft Office Suite

**WORKING CONDITIONS & PHYSICAL DEMANDS**

* Work involves some exposure to moderate risk of accident/injury and requires following basic safety precautions
* Requires operating equipment where carelessness could result in injury; standing for extended periods of time and stooping, bending, kneeling, crouching, lifting, pushing, pulling and/or crawling
* Requires manual labor requiring moderate physical exertion (consistent need to lift, push, pull, carry, etc. up to 50 lbs.). May require special safety precautions, such as working around moving parts, machines or with irritant chemicals and may require use of protective clothing or gear
* Requires communicating information with co-workers, stakeholders and/or the public; reading basic documents and/or following verbal instructions and filling in forms

**COMPENSATION + BENEFIT DETAILS**

* Job Grade: 7 Operations
* Salary Range: $20 per hour

***Diversity Makes Us Stronger Together:*** Prospect Park Alliance serves park users of all socio-economic and cultural backgrounds and strives to reflect this diversity throughout our operations and in our leadership, staff, stakeholders and supporters. We know that by creating an equitable and inclusive workplace built on mutual respect and the appreciation of difference, our employees will feel safe to express themselves, voice their opinions and work together to find common ground and solutions. Integral to this vision is our longstanding commitment to provide equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment.

title: Universal Pre-K Job description
description:
**Universal Pre-K Job description**

**Lead TeacherSummary: Provides a stimulating, safe, and developmentally appropriate educational environment where preschool children have the opportunity to develop cognitive, social, emotional, and physical skills. May lead and functionally supervise teachers assistants. We follow all rules and regulations as written by the New York State Office of Children and Family Services, found at www.ocfs.ny.gov.**

**Essential Functions:**

* Provide for a curriculum appropriate to the ages of the children and their developmental levels and interests, including children with developmental delays or disabilities, which promote the children’s cognitive, educational, social, cultural, physical, emotional, language, and recreational development.
* Consistently treat children, parents, staff, and members fairly, with dignity, respect, and compassion, while maintaining confidentiality.
* Establish, implement, and post a daily schedule of program activities that offers reasonable regularity in routines, including snack and meal periods, nap and rest periods, indoor activities, daily outdoor playtime and a variety of large muscle activities throughout the day. There must be physical activity, appropriate to the ages of the children in care, every day. All schedules must include a routine of good personal hygiene practices.
* Know and understand the Mandated Reporter Policy.
* Provide competent and direct supervision of children at all times for the health and safety of all of the children, by keeping them in sight and sound at all times. This includes supervising children from other classrooms when in common spaces or combined.
* Provide for a program of self-initiated, group-initiated, and teacher-initiated activities which are intellectually stimulating and foster self-reliance and social responsibility.
* Provide opportunities for learning and self-expression in small and large groups. Maintain a portfolio on each child, including copies of assessment tools, samples of artwork, projects, writing, and pictures.
* Establish and maintain positive, professional, and effective communication and supportive ties with children, staff, parents, and third party consultants to meet the needs of children and their families, thereby establishing a partnership between school and home.
* Maintain positive discipline methods in class at all times, promoting self-esteem in children in such a way as to help children develop self-control and assume responsibility for their actions through clear and consistent rules and limits appropriate to the age and development of the child. Corporal punishment is prohibited.

**Administrative and Classroom Responsibilities**

* Maintain and individualize notes sent home to parents.
* Conduct daily health checks of all children entering the room in which you start your day. Maintain daily movement sheets and the attendance sheets and contact lists of all of the children as you travel throughout the building and grounds.
* Maintain daily and weekly cleaning checklists, including the preparation of daily bleach bottles.
* Maintain student to teacher ratios at all times.
* Monitor growth and development of each child and communicate progress/concerns to the Director and parents, by maintaining developmental milestone charts and other forms of evaluation tools on each child.
* Maintain a clean and organized classroom which is colorful and print rich, with shelves, toys, and equipment labeled and in good repair.
* Participate in regular staff meetings and trainings, and scheduled evening events for parents including parent teacher conferences, meet the teacher night, and graduation.
* Attend all required training classes to meet the required hours as stated by the New York State Office of Children and Family Services

**Physical Demands and Work Requirements:**

* Employees must have the ambulatory ability to stand, walk, sit, and reach for objects.
* Employees must occasionally lift and/or move up to 35 pounds.
* Employees must have visual acuity, including close vision, distance vision.

Satisfy the mandatory physical and background checks as required by state and company regulations. Be of sufficient physical, mental and emotional health to perform job duties satisfactorily Possess skills, attributes and characteristics conducive to and suitable for dealing with children \\* Must speak English well enough to communicate with children, staff, management, and parents

* Must be a team player and have a positive attitude

Must be able to read and write English well enough to prepare, complete, and maintain administrative forms and records as required by current governmental regulations, company policies, and procedures. \\* Employees must have the ability to focus and work efficiently in an environment with low to moderate noise level.Must have thorough understanding of OCFS regulations.\\

**Schedule: Monday to Friday**

**Requirements:**CPR Certification (Preferred)Bachelors or Masters in Education

NYS Certified B-2. COVID Certification accepted.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $30.00 - $36.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: National Training Manager
description:
Description:
**ORGANIZATIONAL OVERVIEW**


STRIVE is a national leader with a mission to provide pathways to life-changing careers and opportunities through comprehensive professional training, intensive personal support, and self-empowerment for those who face societal barriers to advancement. Predominately operating in low-income, Black and Brown communities, STRIVE celebrates 85,000 graduates since its founding in 1984. STRIVE's purpose is to ensure that everyone can achieve upward mobility and financial empowerment for themselves and their families and offers free programs to adults of various ages, genders, and with justice-impacted backgrounds. See why STRIVE Works in this 2-minute video or learn more at strive.org.


STRIVE is active in 14 U.S. locations: in four directly-operated sites and through 10 licensed partners across the country. STRIVE is embarking on a growth plan in order to have the capacity to serve 10,000 individuals a year by 2033. To achieve this ambitious goal, we need to significantly expand our capacity in locations we are currently in and expand to new communities that are in need of our services.

**POSITION SUMMARY**


The National Training Manager will be a key member of The Programs & Impact team whose purpose is to support quality programming across the STRIVE network, supporting the efforts of STRIVE’s national presence by promoting impactful student recruitment strategies that connect eligible students to available STRIVE programming. This position will assist in supporting STRIVE’s national network and developing staff who help individuals connect to full-time employment and careers through STRIVE’s Five Pillar programs.


Requirements:
**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

**Program Quality, Fidelity & Support Responsibilities**

* Design and implement training for Employment Specialists and business development program staff using STRIVE's learning management platform, utilizing tools and resources designed for Employment Specialists.
* Provide onboarding, training and continuous coaching to STRIVE Employment Specialists in managed sites, affiliates and grant funded agencies – virtually and in-person via STRIVE processes and event(s).
* Execute Community of Practice model end-to-end for Employment Specialists and Business Development team members to support system-wide employment, placement & retention strategies.
* Oversee the tracking and reporting of business development metrics, including employer partnerships secured, job placements, key employment retention milestones, and case notes/interview referrals.
* Set baseline performance standards for Employment Specialists across the network.
* Conduct quarterly performance and progress meetings with employment specialists and business development teams to evaluate performance, address challenges, and set actionable goals.
* Assist program sites to improve employment placement and retention outcomes, and employer relationships.
* Lead site specific business development relationship strategy session, including relationship management targets and goals – May require in-person strategy and training/coaching sessions.
* Collaborate with other organizations and program staff to onboard and orient Employment Specialists.
* Assist in the onboarding of Employment Specialists to the organization and the role via the implementation of individual training plans.
* Provide additional support for Employment Specialists who do not meet employment placement standards.
* Collaborate with Program heads and managers to establish and maintain training metrics and to evaluate the effectiveness of employment placement activities.
* Offer guidance on the workforce development, employability and professionalism components of the creation of national professional development opportunities.

**Affiliate Membership Support Responsibilities**

* Support affiliates with recurring, scheduled train-the-trainer, and technical training development programs.
* Conduct regular trainer observations and provide feedback and coaching as needed.
* Plays mentorship role to training personnel in the STRIVE network, ensuring constant development of their training and facilitation skills.
* Additional responsibilities as assigned

**QUALIFICATIONS**

* Bachelor’s degree required
* Ability to interact positively with a variety of personalities and populations and to maintain confidentiality
* Knowledge of the local labor market and employer requirements
* Occasional travel, up to 20%, may be required to provide support to STRIVE network sites
* Knowledge of workforce development best practices with experience in community outreach and engagement
* Experience in job readiness or workforce development required
* Must be computer proficient with a working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook
* Must have excellent administrative, communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills

 **STRIVE offers a rich benefits package that includes:**

* Health insurance
* Dental insurance
* Life insurance
* Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
* Pre-tax Commuter Benefits Program
* 401k with employer match
* 20 days of PTO (pro-rated for part-time employees)
* Sick leave
* Up to $500 annual professional development reimbursement
* Paid holidays (including week of Christmas)
* Early closing each Friday during the Summers
* And numerous additional benefits!

**Location:** Location: STRIVE locations, including Atlanta, Birmingham, New Orleans operating sites, with the ability to work in office at least 2 times per week. Occasional travel to other STRIVE offices required.

*STRIVE considers applicants for all positions without regard to: race; color; religion; gender; national origin; age; sexual orientation; marital or veteran status; the presence of a medical condition, genetic information or handicap, unrelated to performing the tasks of the job; or any other legally protected status.*

title: Assistant Director of School- Early Childhood Education
description:
Description:
**Assistant Director of School**

**Monday- Friday 1030-630 Daily**


At Apple Montessori Schools, we understand that guiding the development of children is a great responsibility and that is why we search for passionate people who hope to grow while making a lasting impact on children’s lives. If you are inspired to grow your leadership career in education with a successful company this may be your opportunity. Now hiring an **Assistant Director of School in Randolph, NJ location.**

**As a member of our management team, some of your responsibilities will include:**

* Conduct program registration, and maintain appropriate files and waiting lists.
* Confer with parents on a regular basis to discuss the development of their enrolled children.
* Plan and implement activities to meet the physical, emotional, intellectual and social needs of the children in the program.
* Develop culturally appropriate programs and activities.
* Establish routines and provide positive guidance.
* Maintains accurate and timely educational assessments and progress notes for all assigned students.
* Maintains ratios at all times, and keeps attendance records of children throughout the day.
* Conduct parent observations and tours.
* Conduct/attend all required Teacher In-Service days.
* Manage CRM software.
* Maintain employee data and timecards in the Payroll/Human Resource Platform (Paylocity)
* Participate in Mentor/Mentee program and training program..

**What Apple Montessori Schools can offer you:**

* Excellent medical, dental, and vision benefits for eligible employees
* 65% childcare discount
* Competitive Paid Time off package
* Holiday Pay including a Holiday Break Week
* Discount on personal Verizon Wireless accounts.
* Career Path Opportunities – Grow with Apple!
* Work Life Balance
* As an IACET Accredited Provider, (Apple Montessori Schools) offers IACET CEUs for its learning events that comply with the ANSI/IACET Continuing Education and Training Standard."

**"(Apple Montessori Schools) is accredited by the International Accreditors for Continuing Education and Training (IACET) and offers IACET CEUs for its learning events that comply with the ANSI/IACET Continuing Education and Training Standard. IACET is recognized internationally as a standard development organization and accrediting body that promotes quality of continuing education and training."**


Requirements:
**Ready to apply? Below are our requirements:**

* A Bachelor’s degree in Education or related field.
* A minimum 1 to 3 years’ managerial experience.
* A preferred 2 years of experience in a school setting.
* Requirement to complete NAMC within 1 year of employment
* Capacity to understand and manage center staffing, enrollment and inventory.
* Ability to respond effectively and appropriately in different situations.
* Ability to provide excellent customer service to current and prospective families.
* Strong leadership skills and the ability to communicate with staff effectively.
* Strong organizational skills and the ability to meet deadlines.

title: scientist
description:
Job Summary
A Sr. Lead Scientist position is available within the Scent R&D division at one of the world’s leading fragrance and flavor companies. This New Jersey based position is one that offers the ability to drive the future of the scent ingredient catalog through innovative ingredient discovery. This role connects basic R&D discovery with the critical needs of the Scent Business unit. Superior technical ability coupled with out of the box thinking, exceptional communication skills as well as a growth mindset are all required for success.
Responsibilities:* Lead new ingredient discovery projects that align with BU goals and aspirations.
* Drive discovery and utilization of new chemical technologies to enable the preparation of next-generation fragrance ingredients
* Partner with Technology Scouts to identify key external partners to work with, including, but not limited to Consortia, CROs, startups and suppliers.
* Be a technical expert mentoring junior employees in the art and science of fragrance ingredient discovery.
* Analyze complex and possibly incomplete data to make research decisions
* Engages team, stakeholders and leadership in planning and achieving strategic objectives. Monitors opportunities and threats and takes action to adapt work to meet goals.
* Leads project collaborations with internal and external customers.
* Engages internal and external stakeholders to define needs, develop research strategy, and gain agreement for ultimate plan
* Mentors and acts as a role model to all levels within the organization.
* Builds effective teams via integrating diverse talents, as well as motivating and inspiring members to excel and achieve breakthrough results.


Qualifications:  

* Ph.D. in Organic Chemistry with 12-15 years' experience in the research and development of fragrance ingredients or related. Demonstrated management experience required.
* Solid, broad-based knowledge of the fragrance industry including applications, manufacturing and regulatory issues. Excellent communication and team building skills essential.
* Ability to manage multiple, unrelated projects at once.
* Experienced with IP/ patent filing and or review
* Experience in landscaping technology areas and working with Legal to determine Freedom To Operate.
* Ability to review complex technical data to make research decisions
* Ability to clearly communicate complex topics to non-technical audiences.

  

 Preferred Experience:
Ph.D. in Organic Chemistry with 15+ years' experience in the research and development of fragrance ingredients. Demonstrated management experience required. Solid broad-based knowledge of the fragrance industry including applications, manufacturing and regulatory issues.
We are a global leader in taste, scent, and nutrition, offering our customers a broader range of natural solutions and accelerating our growth strategy. At IFF, we believe that your uniqueness unleashes our potential. We value the diverse mosaic of the ethnicity, national origin, race, age, sex, or veteran status. We strive for an inclusive workplace that allows each of our colleagues to bring their authentic self to work regardless of their religion, gender identity & expression, sexual orientation, or disability.
Visit IFF.com/careers/workplace-diversity-and-inclusion to learn more

title: Flavors Marketing Communications
description:
Job Summary
Flavors Marketing Communications Expert  

  

A senior level global marketing communications position is availability at one of the world’s best fragrance and flavor companies. This strategic position is dedicated to crafting innovative content driving the narrative of IFF’s capabilities in delivering consumer-preferred taste experiences around the world. If you are a fantastic copywriter and marketing maven with at least 15 years of flavors experience in the food and beverage industry, this position could be for you. We are interested in candidates with an inventive mindset, collaborate spirit and passion for results who can grow our brand and industry leadership.  

The successful candidate will be based in the South Brunswick, New Jersey office. There is no relocation with this position. Local candidates only.
As the Senior Manager for Flavors Marketing Communications, you will spend your time in the following areas…
Communications Strategy & Leadership – Map and formulate the opportunities and roadmap for new flavors positionings and communications campaigns aligned with category growth initiatives and holistic flavors growth targets. Amplify differentiation vs. competition and incorporate industry trends, consumer/business intelligence, performance data, insights, and best practices.
Content Creation - Direct the process and narrative content creation to develop compelling stories which communicate IFF’s excellence in flavors and unquestionable credentials as our customers’ partner-of-choice. Liaise effectively with key internal stakeholders and collaborators, along with selected external vendors. Publish best-in-class content which solidifies IFF as the number one communicator of capabilities and instills pride in our organization about how we communicate to the world.
Brand Stewardship - Drive the creation of branded content and stories that set IFF apart in the global food and beverage arena. Maintain brand consistency and deliver on-brand content to targeted audiences.
We are a global leader in taste, scent, and nutrition, offering our customers a broader range of natural solutions and accelerating our growth strategy. title: Scheduler

title: Quality Assurance Analyst
description:
Description:
**Join Our Journey:**


Joining Movora is more than just a career choice; it's an opportunity to be part of a pioneering team that’s leading the way in veterinary health. Every connection we establish and each impact we create contributes to the greater goal. At Movora, your role goes beyond just a job title; you become an integral part of a movement that truly makes a difference – benefiting you, our team, the wider community, and pets across the globe.


At Movora, our Employee Value Proposition is deeply rooted in our Core Values and Vision. It reflects our commitment to enhancing the lives and mobility of companion animals, embodying who we are and what we strive to achieve.

**Empowering You:** Your growth is our priority. We're here to nurture your talents and cheer on your success. You bring the skills; we provide the support and opportunities.

**Teamwork & Integrity:** With a spirit of collaboration, we respect and trust each other. Your contributions help us advance veterinary health as one strong, skilled team.

**Inclusive & Fair:** Movora is your home away from home. We're dedicated to diversity, work-life balance, and ensuring everyone gets their fair share of rewards and recognition.

**Salary**: $55,000-70,000 DOE

**Position Summary:**


The Quality Assurance Analyst supports the implementation and maintenance of quality management systems, with a focus on ensuring that production processes and products adhere to established standards. This role involves documentation management, equipment monitoring, and participation in audits, playing a key part in maintaining product quality and compliance.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

 **Quality Assurance Program Development**

* **Donor & Batch Record Management:** Oversee the creation, organization, and review of donor charts and processing batch files to ensure completeness and compliance. Manage Quarantine Release documents.

**Quality Control Activities:**

* **Support Tissue Processing:** Assist in tissue procurement and processing activities, ensuring readiness and compliance.
* **Validation & Qualification:** Design and conduct validation studies and equipment qualifications. Maintain thorough equipment recordkeeping and manage calibrations.

**Quality Control & Assurance Activities:**

* **Documentation Management:** Assist in the creation, review, and organization of production and quality records, including donor and batch records, to ensure accuracy and compliance with SOPs.
* **Labeling Control:** Support the development and management of labeling for products, ensuring labels meet regulatory and quality requirements.
* **Process Monitoring:** Monitor production processes to ensure adherence to quality standards and identify opportunities for improvement.
* **Audit Participation:** Assist in conducting internal audits of production processes, equipment, and systems to verify compliance with quality management systems.
* **Incident Reporting:** Participate in the investigation and documentation of incidents, errors, complaints, and adverse reactions, and help implement corrective actions as necessary.

**Environmental & Quality Maintenance:**

* **Environmental Monitoring:** Help maintain the environmental monitoring program, ensuring that the production environment meets regulatory and quality standards.
* **Process Improvement:** Contribute to identifying areas for process improvements and assist in implementing corrective and preventive actions.

**Documentation & Records Management:**

* **Document Control:** Assist in maintaining current and archived versions of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), job aids, forms, and other quality-related documents.
* **Training Documentation:** Help manage training records to ensure that all staff are adequately trained and that training documentation is up-to-date.
* **Quality Reporting:** Assist in preparing quality documentation and reports by collecting and analyzing data from production and quality activities.

**Additional Responsibilities:**

* **General Support:** Provide support in answering client questions and performing other tasks as needed to ensure the smooth operation of the quality assurance program.

*The above cited duties and responsibilities describe the general nature and level of work performed by people assigned to the job.* *They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all the duties and responsibilities that an incumbent may be expected or asked to perform.*

**Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:**

**Quality Management Systems (QMS)**: In-depth understanding of QMS principles, including ISO standards, GMP, and other regulatory frameworks relevant to tissue banking and medical manufacturing.

**Regulatory Compliance**: Familiarity with FDA regulations, AATB standards, and other guidelines critical for ensuring compliance in tissue banking and medical devices.

**Analytical Thinking:** Strong ability to analyze complex data, identify trends, and make informed decisions to ensure quality and compliance.

**Attention to Detail:** High level of precision and accuracy in reviewing documents, performing audits, and handling quality control tasks.

**Problem-Solving:** Proficiency in identifying problems, generating effective solutions, and implementing corrective actions promptly.

**Organization & Time Management:** able to work independently with minimal supervision, planning, scheduling, and organizing professional schedule to complete actions within established deadlines, handling multiple priorities with strong attention to detail.


Requirements:
**Education:** BS in Biology or related field; equivalent experience will be considered.

**Experience:**

* Minimum of 2 years in QA/QC programs, and 3 years in tissue banking, medical manufacturing, laboratory procedures, or sterile/clean room environments. Required experience.
* Strong communication, documentation, and organizational skills with a high attention to detail.
* Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access).
* Familiarity with Universal Precautions and experience handling potentially contaminated tissues is preferred.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong focus on customer needs and the ability to translate customer feedback into quality improvements.

**About Movora**


Movora is the place for leaders with the ambition to shape the future in our field of veterinary MedTech.


 With decades of expertise in the advancement of animal health, we have the vision, drive and passion to lead and transform veterinary MedTech for many years to come. Together, our team focuses on pet health and mobility as a single resource for industry-leading medical technology - from classroom to clinic, sharing the goal of extending and enhancing pets’ lives.

**Benefits Offered:**

* **Health & Wellness:** A well-rounded benefits program featuring medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short and long-term disability options, and an Employee Assistance Program.
* **Retirement Planning:** Participate in our 401(k) plan, with Movora matching 100% of your first 4% contribution. Please see plan summary for more details.
* **Work-Life Balance:** Earn paid time off (PTO) according to our guidelines, starting with the equivalent of 10 days each year for your first 3 years, you may carry over up to 40 hours each year. We also have programs such as Summer Hours from June to August.
* **Holiday & Personal/Sick Time:** You will also be provided with 40 hours of Sick/Personal time to be used for illness, doctors’ appointments, school meetings for your kids, etc. Movora offers six company-paid holidays and one floating holiday annually.
* **Additional Voluntary Benefits:** Choose from optional programs such as Accident Insurance, Critical Illness and Volunteer Programs.


As a drug-free workplace, we conduct mandatory drug screens for all prospective employees. Please be advised that a drug screen will be administered as part of the pre-employment process. This screening is a standard procedure designed to ensure the well-being and safety of all team members.


Movora is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing an inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees are treated with respect and dignity. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.


We actively encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply for our positions. We believe that a diverse workforce enhances the quality and innovation of our work.


Join us in fostering an environment that promotes equal opportunities and celebrates diversity.


If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation in the application or recruiting process, please contact hr@movora.com

title: Facilities Technician
description:
**About us:**
-------------

**ConnectOne Bank proves that putting people first is a better way to do business.** At ConnectOne, we’re builders — of businesses, communities, and equity. Most importantly, we’re building opportunities. Our mission is to ensure our employees feel empowered to make important decisions, reach their potential and truly make an impact.


ConnectOne is a growth organization by design; it is part of our DNA and we take pride in seeing our employees grow with us. Founded in 2005 by an entrepreneur, we have grown into a high-performing commercial bank, inspiring a new model for our industry’s future. By embracing technology and all the ways it can help us become a world-class service organization, we support small business owners by fueling their mission.


People First is the blueprint for our culture. It is at the foundation of everything we do and the decisions we make. At ConnectOne, you have the opportunity to be a part of a dynamic culture and team. Develop your forward-thinking skills, thrive in an entrepreneurial setting, and succeed at “a better place to be”.


ConnectOne Bank is an Equal Housing and Equal Opportunity Lender, and a member of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation.

**About this role****:**
------------------------


The Facilities Technician is responsible for performing a variety of general maintenance and repair duties throughout the corporate offices and branch network.

**In this role you will****:**
------------------------------

* Support the Bank’s “People First” focus and rules of engagement—maintaining a professional demeanor, working as an active member of the CNOB team, providing all clients excellent service, always striving to make CNOB “A Better Place to Be”.
* Daily activities are determined by Facilities Help Desk tickets and direction from Facilities Manager and Construction Manager.
* Performs minor electrical maintenance (e.g. wall switches and outlets, light bulbs, ballast, sockets, fuses, minor appliances, cords, using appropriate hand, power and specialty tools).
* Performs minor painting, carpentry and masonry work.
* Reconfigures, installs, positions and remounts office furniture and space.
* Reports observed deficiencies in facilities and buildings to manager.
* Performs other work related duties as assigned.
* Travel required between CNOB branch location and external client sites.
* Wear PPE as required.

**Must haves****:**
-------------------

* Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing.
* Ability to push equipment weighing up to 100 lbs., to lift equipment up to 50 lbs., and work in small areas.

**Bonus Points For:**
---------------------

* Strong “People First” interest and ability.
* Basic understanding of electrical, plumbing and carpentry

**Additional information**
--------------------------

**Benefits:**

* World class health, vision, and dental benefits on day one
* 401k with employer match
* Hybrid work from home (depending on role)
* Employee appreciation events (team building, softball games, food truck days, etc..)
* Employee assistance programs (EAP)
* Wellness programs (flu shot, preventive care, health programs and services discounts, etc..)
* Tuition reimbursement
* Employee Discount perks
* CNOB Community Service Events

**….and much, much more!**


Studies have shown that individuals from underrepresented groups, may only apply to roles if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Roles evolve over time, especially with innovation, and you may be just the person we need. We hope you're open to learning new skills and growing with us. We encourage you to apply to continue making us “a better place to be!”


ConnectOne Bank is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate with respect to any term, condition or privilege of employment based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, military or veteran status, marital status, or status of an individual in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.


ConnectOne Bank also provides reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act and applicable state and local laws. If an accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, please contact Talent Acquisition.
