title: Summit, NJ Sales Specialist Partner
description:
**Exciting Opportunity with Podcast Plus Media!**

**About Us:**  
Podcast Plus Media is expanding to your hometown, and we’re looking for dedicated full-time Partners to join our team! We specialize in providing unique, affordable marketing solutions across digital, social media, podcast, and TV platforms to help small businesses stand out.

**Position Summary:**  
We’re seeking an entrepreneurial-minded sales expert to lead our sales efforts across multiple media platforms. If you have a deep understanding of the local market, strong relationships with local businesses, and a knack for sales, we want to hear from you! Experience in local digital, podcasting, and print & broadcast advertising sales is a plus, but not required.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Host 20-minute podcasts with business owners in your community.
* Help local businesses grow through your shows while identifying new sales opportunities.
* Leverage the support of your dedicated partner, Garfield, to effectively acquire and monetize clients.

**Requirements:**

* High-speed internet, a fairly new laptop, and a quiet room for recording podcasts.
* Ability to maintain and grow relationships with clients, ensuring their satisfaction.
* Comfortable with computers and popular software.
* Stay informed about industry trends, competitor activities, and local market conditions.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Communications, or a related field. Extensive sales experience will be considered in lieu of a degree.
* Minimum of 5 years of sales experience. However, we’re open to training those with entrepreneurial experience running their own business.
* Proven track record of achieving sales targets and driving revenue growth.
* Strong knowledge of local market dynamics and media landscape.
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
* Ability to think strategically and execute effectively.

**What Sets Us Apart:**  
At Podcast Plus Media, we offer a work-life balance that allows you to achieve significant earnings without compromising your quality of life. With Garfield as your partner, you’ll receive essential support and training to ensure your success.

**How to Apply:**  
Ready to join our dynamic team? Email your resume for immediate consideration. We’ll schedule a Zoom meeting to explore this exciting profit-sharing opportunity in more detail.

**Why Join Podcast Plus Media:**

* Be part of a growing media company expanding into a vibrant market.
* Collaborate with Garfield, your dedicated partner, for personalized support.
* Experience limitless earning potential with our streamlined approach.
* Advance your career while helping local business owners in your community!

Join Podcast Plus Media today and be part of an exciting journey to empower local businesses and elevate your career!

title: Dental Patient Accounts Representative
description:
**Dental Patient Accounts Representative**


**Required Qualifications (as evidenced by an attached resume):**  

Associate's Degree from a college or university program accredited by an agency recognized by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA) with one (1) year working experience in public health or related industry such as insurance. In lieu of degree, two (2) years of working experience in public health or related industry such as insurance or a related industry may be considered.  

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**  

Billing, Accounts Receivable, Dental Experience, or hospital patient access/registration experience. Experience working with dental insurance benefits. Experience working with dental terminology. Previous experience as a dental billing/registration representative. Experience with EMR computerized registration/financial/IT systems. Bilingual in English and Spanish.  

  

**Brief Description of Duties:**  

At Stony Brook School of Dental Medicine, our Dental Patient Account Representative is responsible for completing varied, diverse and specialized duties to support the Revenue Cycle, Compliance and Patient Experience by accurately and efficiently completing tasks. The Representative is responsible for verifying insurance, working with the patients and providers to create financial treatment plans, collecting patient balances, posting payments in our electronic POS payment system, reconciling payments for bank deposits, and submitting claims to insurance carriers. This role requires professional interaction with all hospital and clinical staff and facilitates a positive experience in all patient encounters. This position is a key representative to the Dental team. The representative interacts in a professional, respectful manner with internal and external customers, provides excellent customer service to patients and visitors. The Representative adheres to strict rules of confidentiality, department, and organizational policies and procedures. Qualified candidates will demonstrate excellent communication and interpersonal skills, knowledge and understanding of patient care and effectively respond to changing patient needs by making decisions based on ethical principles and adhering to our high standard of excellence. Demonstrated excellence in verbal and written communication, computing, and multi-tasking skills in a fast-paced environment. Candidates must demonstrate experience and expertise in speaking with customers and can work well with people who are under stress (such as sick patients and their distressed family members).  

**Duties** **of a Dental Patient Accounts Representative may include the following but are not limited to****:**
* Verifies insurance, determines eligibility and patient cost share (co-pay / deposit etc.) using electronic systems and other means.
* Obtains complete and accurate patient demographic and insurance information, ensuring data is current and coverage verified to sufficiently meet requirements to generate a “clean” bill.
* Provides financial guidance and excellence in Financial Care to patients and their representatives, presenting information about their benefit coverage and cost share responsibilities.
* Works with Providers to provide treatment plans/payment plans/financial responsibility to patients.
* Responsible for collecting and posting co-pays, deposits, and deductibles at time of patient visit.
* Reviews providers clinical notes to determine if procedure code selected is correct.
* Reviews charts and communicate to providers with specific information required to bill claims in a timely manner.
* Submits claims by paper and electronically with proper attachments.
* Ensures that compliance regulations are met (presenting and securing consents and regulatory signatures from patients or designee, essential for treatment and payment, as per procedure).
* Maintains and requires appropriate documents as necessary (i.e. copies of photo ID and insurance documents etc. Witnesses’ general consents, agreements, and acknowledgements.
* Reconciles petty cash bags to ensure that the issued amount is consistently maintained.
* Communicates professionally with colleagues, patients and answers calls directed to the Cashier Office. Demonstrates a positive organizational attitude and commitment to patient experience. Maintains respectful and compassionate demeanor and provides high-quality patient centered care.
* Other duties or projects as assigned as appropriate to rank and departmental mission.
  

  

**Special Notes:**  

This is a full-time appointment. FLSA Non-Exempt position, eligible for the overtime provisions of the FLSA.  

  

In addition to the employee's base salary, this position is eligible for $3,087 UUP annual location pay, paid biweekly.  

  

**Essential Position:** This has been designated as an essential position based on the duties of the job and the functions performed. Positions that are designated as such may be required to report to work/remain at work even if classes are canceled, and the campus is working on limited operations in an emergency.  

  

For this position, we are unable to sponsor candidates for work visas.  

  

Resume/CV and cover letter should be included with the online application.  

  

***Stony Brook University is committed to excellence in diversity and the creation of an inclusive learning, and working environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, familial status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status and all other protected classes under federal or state laws.***  

  

If you need a disability-related accommodation, please call the university Office of Equity and Access (OEA) at (631) 632-6280 or visit OEA.  

  

*In accordance with the Title II Crime Awareness and Security Act* a *copy of our crime statistics can be viewed**here**.*  

  

Visit our **WHY WORK HERE** page to learn about the **total rewards** we offer.  

  

**The starting salary range (or hiring range) to be offered for this position is noted below, it represents SBU’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of possible compensation at the time of posting.**

title: Bakery Hourly Supervisor - West Village
description:
Embrace a leadership role as the Front of the House Supervisor at Mah-Ze-Dahr, where your energetic and enthusiastic approach will contribute to creating a clean, organized, and positive work environment. As a key player in overseeing daily operations, you will supervise staff, foster a welcoming atmosphere, and ensure exceptional guest interactions. Your role involves maintaining high cleanliness standards, addressing guest concerns, and collaborating seamlessly with other departments to uphold the Mah-Ze-Dahr brand.

Customer Service

* Prioritizing hospitality, creating welcoming and clean environment for guest and teammates
* Act as brand ambassador. As face of the company with guests, BSA must embody companies core values, able to speak to company mission and history
* Be knowledgeable about product, able to answer guest questions and offer recommendations on pastries and beverages
* Foster relationships with guests, building a deeper connection, moving interaction from transactional to continued relationship
* Knowledge of procedures for taking orders and fulfillment, including in store purchase as well online preorders
* Ability to operate Point of Sales (POS), ringing up guests accurately and collect payment (cash or credit)
* Understanding of all company service channels and how to connect guest to correct contact if unable to help guest directly
* Implement upselling techniques whenever possible to maximize sales
* Manage guest interactions over the phone utilizing proper phone etiquette per Mah-Ze-Dahr guidelines

Food Handling

* Package orders accurately and ensuring are aesthetically pleasing
* Using company guidelines, ensure product is packaged properly, maximizing visual appeal and product integrity
* Memorize company recipes, producing beverages and product to company standards, while minimizing waste
* Flexibility to accommodate guest’s special requests when possible
* Putting away deliveries, restocking food and beverage as needed, always ensuring to rotate product, using oldest first (FIFO)
* Work cleanly and organized at all times, guaranteeing the safety of guests and team members
* Uphold all Department of Health (DOH) regulations

Management

* Key contact for all employee and guest issues in absence of higher management
* Foster a positive work environment
* Generate “game plan” and coach team for shift, ensuring all employees are embodying MZD culture and policy
* Ensure the store is clean and organized at all times
* Manage flow behind counter, keeping team on task
* Addresses all guest concerns
* Document activity during shift including, Cash Drawer Report, Logbook, and communicate directly with manager as needed
* Adhere to Opening/Closing Checklist, and guarantee Daily Chore Log is completed daily
* Contact guests who have not picked up pre-orders before the end of day.
* Ensure all preorders are packaged at the beginning of every shift, communicate new orders to managers/shift supervisors
* Complete a “Shift Handoff” in the middle of day, communicating key information between shifts
* Key contact for emergency, contact managers as needed
* Complete DOH inspections
* Communicating ordering needs with managers
* Fostering Community with Neighbors and vendors/collaborators

Training

* Working under the General Manager direction, train new staff and promote continuous growth of team members
* Facilitate Buddy Shifts with new employees, provide feedback to General Manager
* Ensure new employees follow company procedures
* Communicate BSA development with management team
* Provide on the spot feedback to fellow team members

**our ideal candidate:**

* has a knowledge and love of coffee and pastries
* has 1-2 years experiments as a supervisor/key holder in food service/retail or comparable business
* has 1-2 years experience at coffee shop/bakery or comparable business
* must have a Food Handler's License (test reimbursement)
* can command of proper food handling procedures
* can operate necessary equipment related to the job including, but not limited to: espresso machine, coffee grinder, batch brewer, pos system
* has an eagerness to learn about bakery offerings and pastry pairings, and the ability to articulate the uniqueness of our pastries to guests
* can create espresso drinks based on bakery menu, to guests' preferences
* has the ability to work both independently and as a strong team player
* is familiar with fast paced and high volume environments
* has a strong work ethic
* is timely and reliable
* will maintain uncompromising levels of cleanliness

**what we offer:** 

This position is an opportunity for you to develop your career and learn in a dynamic, critically-acclaimed business.

* 401(k) with matching program

title: Benefits Assistant
description:
**Benefits Assistant**

 **Required Qualifications (as evidenced by an attached resume):**  

Bachelor’s degree (foreign equivalent or higher). Experience with administering employee benefits, to include experience with health insurance and related presentations. Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite and/or Google Workspace. Prior experience in a customer service related environment.  

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**  

Bachelor’s degree (foreign equivalent or higher) in Human Resources, Business Administration or a related field. At least one (1) year of experience with administering employee benefits, to include experience with health insurance and related presentations. Experience working in a higher education environment and/or state agency. Knowledge of NYBEAS, Oracle, PeopleSoft and/or PayServ. Experience utilizing a scanning system.  

  

**Brief Description of Duties:**  

The Benefits Assistant will be responsible for the administration of the employee benefit plans for State, Research Foundation and Student employees. Incumbent will educate, inform and counsel employees in regards to health benefits including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, as well as irrevocable retirement decisions. The selected candidate will have strong presentation and analytical skills. They must be able to provide world class customer service and develop a positive rapport with customers.
* **Educate, Inform, Counsel:**
	+ Schedule individual sessions with new employees – collect necessary documents for implementing benefit coverage.
	+ Conduct new hire orientation in a group setting twice a week.
	+ Communicates with employees and students at all levels of the organization.
	+ Handle confidential information using sound judgment and utmost discretion.
* **Data Management:**
	+ Updates and maintains electronic employee files for employee benefits and assists the Payroll Department with deductions or changes as it relates to the payroll system.
	+ Ensures compliance with all plan documents, Employee Retirement Income Security Act (ERISA), and Federal and State regulations.
	+ Processes all Health Insurance enrollments, Tax Deferred Annuities, Tuition-Waiver applications, and M/C Life Insurance enrollments applications for all Research Foundation and State employees.
	+ Processes COBRA and compliance reporting.
	+ Works closely with various campus departments such as: Student Health insurance, Grants Management and RF Payroll to ensure timely administration, accurate financial recording and compliance with overall University policies and federal immigration laws relative to health insurance.
* **Administration:**
	+ Prioritizes and organizes daily responsibilities in order to meet all deadlines.
	+ Assists with the determination/duration associated with the FMLA based on the information given by the healthcare provider.
	+ Communicates Disability and FMLA approvals, denials, leave extensions, re-certifications, return to work plans to all Supervisors, Managers, and Vice President Coordinators (VPC).
	+ Communicates Disability and FMLA approvals, denials, leave extensions, re-certifications, return to work plans to all Supervisors, Managers, and Vice President Coordinators (VPC).
	+ Assists with management of leaves that are concurrent with Short Term Disability, Long Term Disability and Workers' Compensation.
* **Graduate Student Employees & Fellows:**
	+ Assists with the development and documentation of procedures and processes for the administration of health insurance programs and provides data on enrollment transactions, customer inquiries and problems with health vendor services.
	+ Processes all health insurance waivers for those enrolled in the State or RF health insurance plans.
	+ Notify the Student Health Office of any Graduate Student Employee and/or Fellow termination to ensure each student is properly charged and insured.
	+ Disseminates pertinent health insurance communications to the Graduate Student Employees and the Graduate Coordinators throughout the University.
* **Other duties or projects as assigned as appropriate to rank and departmental mission.**
  


**Special Notes:**  

This is a Management Confidential position. This is a full-time appointment. FLSA Non Exempt position, eligible for the overtime provisions of the FLSA.  

  

For this position, we are unable to sponsor candidates for work visas.  

  

Resume/CV and cover letter should be included with the online application.

title: Project Coordinator
description:
We are looking for a Project Manager/Coordinator located in New Jersey. We are a dynamic technology company that specializes in Federal Law Compliance and Connected Building Safety Hardware. We are looking for an enthusiastic individual to lead, manage projects, and deliver exceptional results for our clients. We currently support clients across Educational, Governmental, Healthcare, Religious, Retail, and Public Industries.

As a Project Manager/Coordinator you will work with our internal team, business partners, and clients to drive scoped solutions on time without compromising quality. You are an organized planning guru who has a keen eye for details. The upmost importance to this position is setting agreed project timelines to create and maintain strong quality relationships with our clients.

This is a full-time on-site position located in Wall Township. Final position, title, and salary details will be based on selected candidate’s experience, education, and qualifications.

Responsibilities

* Review contracted scope of work for project related milestones and associated billable deliverables.
* Ensure that every project is managed to maximize client satisfaction driven by an agreed project schedule with task owners.
* Onboard client to 911inform Portal, create Client Shared Directory, and Maintain Project workflow on Monday.com.
* Maintain risk, action, issue, and decision logs that span the lifecycle of the project.
* Work with internal team to develop contingency plans to mitigate potential risks to account for and overcome any items on the critical path being delayed.
* Make sure that all stakeholders are updated regarding project status at a minimum on a weekly basis.
* Provide meeting minutes and action items to all stakeholders upon completion of project meetings.
* Responsible for ensuring all assets and resources are identified to successfully meet client expectations/requirements.
* Track client requests and escalate any potential change orders for internal review.
* Adhere to a standard RAG status for all active and on-hold projects.
* Provide clients with training materials regarding 911inform.
* Completion of client UAT, project closure, and handoff to internal 2nd Day Support.

Requirements

* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Must know Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, and Powerpoint)
* Must be self-motivated & punctual.
* Must be able to manage upwards of 6-10 highly technical projects at a time.
* Excellent follow-up skills both internally and externally.
* Must be professional and polished in appearance and speech.
* Agile Project Management experience (preferred)
* IT Project Management experience (preferred)
* Project Management certifications (preferred)
* Bachelor’s Degree (preferred)

Work Remotely

* No

Job Type: Full Time

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* No weekends

Ability to Commute:

* Township of Wall, NJ 07727 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Staff Assistant
description:
**Staff Assistant**


**Required Qualifications:(as evidenced by an attached resume)**  

Bachelor’s degree (foreign equivalent or higher). Two (2) years of full-time administrative experience. Highly proficient, professional experience in word processing, spreadsheet management, electronic messaging, and internet applications (Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Google Apps, etc...). Experience coordinating events. Experience working with computer systems such as: PeopleSoft, Wolfmart, SBU Reporting, BI, RF Report Center, SOLAR, 25Live, etc.  

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**  

Advanced degree (foreign equivalent or higher). Experience working in a Higher Education/ Academic environment. Extensive working knowledge of SUNY and/or SBU policies, practices, and procedures. Grant management experience.  

  

**Brief Description of Duties:**  

Stony Brook University’s Chemistry Department scholars build and use their fundamental understanding of molecular structure to innovatively solve problems in order to improve the human condition globally. Undergraduate students, graduate students, and postdoctoral researchers all work closely with faculty to innovate and educate in the acquisition and application of chemical knowledge. Stony Brook Chemistry partners with local and global communities in our research and education enterprise. Therefore, having experience interacting with individuals at various levels within an institution is highly preferred. This position is tasked with administrative support of the Chemistry Department and its student population.  

  

The incumbent will be responsible for (i) appointment and reappointment of all state and RF funded students working in Chemistry, (ii) support of departmental training grants which support student research, (iii) maintenance of researcher training records; as well as (iv) event planning, (v) managing communications outlets, and (vi) assisting with a variety of other departmental support tasks related to serving the needs of our students.



The successful incumbent will have excellent customer service and interpersonal skills, exercising strong organizational and time-management skills with an exceptional attention to detail. Essential for this role is the adeptness to work independently as well as part of a team with a collaborative approach to problem solving as well as experience working with and maintaining confidential information. The selected candidate will use outstanding interpersonal communication skills and sound judgment in decision making, while providing excellent customer service to Chemistry faculty, staff, and students.

  


* Student Appointments
	+ Responsible for all State and RF Student Appointments, awards, fellowships, training grants, and reimbursements for all Chemistry undergraduate and graduate students, working closely with PIs in the preparation and submission of required documentation. Duties include but are not limited to the following:
	+ Periodically gathers student support data from PIs.
	+ Maintains spreadsheets and databases with all data required for student appointments.
	+ Works with the Student Affairs Coordinator to keep a shared spreadsheet for all State and RF student appointments.
	+ Prepares change forms for all appointments, including State, RF, and trainees/fellowships on Departmental training grants.
	+ Keep RF payroll roster and address payroll concerns of graduate students.
	+ Monitors monthly end date/labor schedules for issues with Chemistry student appointments and follow up, as required, to ensure continued student support.
	+ Processes travel reimbursements for all students and recruits.
	+ Processes scholarship payments and awards for undergraduate and graduate students.
	+ Serves as the Effort coordinator and certifies graduate appointments (~200+) in ECC online reporting tool.
	+ Hires Federal Work Study Students and Student Assistants as required for instructional and Departmental support and approve time in SOLAR as required.
	+ Provides guidance to new graduate students during New Student Orientation with processing I-9 paperwork, HRS, and payroll forms, in addition to procedures associated with acquiring an SSN and other relevant on-boarding matters.
	+ Assists in the development of standard practices and operating procedures for enabling student appointments according to state, University, and Agency requirements.
* Training Grants
	+ Support Departmental Student Training Grants
	+ Manages Budget/spending for multiple training award and matching funding initiatives from various State, Research Foundation, and Stony Brook Foundation sources.
	+ Works closely with Directors to ensure appropriate spending of funds and keep records of all spending.
	+ Prepares required Progress Reports.
	+ Coordinates with Directors to schedule monthly and annual meetings, retreats and steering committee meetings and schedule rooms and catering for these events as required.
	+ Assists with the assessment of students and mentors.
	+ Manages electronic records of data, including but not limited to unobligated funds for carry over funding, and demographics for Fellows, Affiliates, Alumni, Applicants, and Publications.
	+ Assists in the development of standard operating practices for administering training grants, according to state, University, and Agency requirements.
* Event Planning
	+ Assists the Faculty, Chair, Department Administrator, and Student Affairs Coordinator with department- sponsored events, thereby helping to promote community building and serving as a Departmental representative at these events and activities.
	+ Coordinates departmental meeting logistics, including disseminating the agenda, coordinating, and reserving any catering, room, and/or A/V needs. Serves as the point of contact for events and takes meeting minutes, as needed.
	+ Creates and maintains electronic schedules and manages reservations for department conference rooms.
	+ Arranges travel and accommodations for seminar speakers, as needed.
	+ Provides logistical support and assistance with Departmental events, such as but not limited to Named Lecture series, Chemistry Research Day, Student award ceremonies, and Graduation events.
	+ Provides assistance with departmental participation at CAS and University events, as needed.
	+ Arranges for catering for events, including department weekly seminars, monthly faculty meetings, etc., according to SUNY and State guidelines.
* Database Management
	+ Effective database management – Creates and builds upon the training, electronic building access, and key distribution systems.
	+ Organizes electronic records of all required student training (including EH&S safety courses and compliance such as CITI training) and notify students when re-training is required.
	+ Training record keeping – Coordinates and manages the training and key distribution systems; maintains electronic records of all required student training; and notifies students when retraining is required.
	+ As necessary, provides logistical support to the Student Affairs Coordinator with course checklists for individual undergraduate chemistry and engineering chemistry majors and chemistry minors in order to ensure effective adherence to course requirements/prerequisites in meeting timelines to expected degree completion.
* Communication Outlets
	+ Coordinates and works with departmental staff and faculty to update department webpage content.
	+ Serves on the Departmental Website and Social Media committee and assists with website design, organization, and content, as needed. Serves as the liaison between the department and related university offices to keep department webpage format updated.
	+ Create, curate, and update alumni undergraduate and graduate student databases.
	+ Updates Departmental program brochures.
	+ Posts content on the Departmental website and related social media accounts, as required
	+ Supports management of promotional material for the Department (Student Recruiting, Orientation, website, Brightspace, newsletter, marketing, etc.), as needed.
* Chemistry Office Duties
	+ Assists with preparation of confidential exams and course materials
	+ Assists the Student Affairs Coordinator with Student Advising, as needed and as appropriate.
	+ Represents the Department at meetings, as needed. Interacts with other University offices as needed, i.e., Dean’s Office, International Academic Programs, Registrar’s Office, Student Accounts, and other academic departments and units, as necessary.
	+ As needed, serves as a contact person for the receipt and distribution of mail and packages.
	+ As with all staff members, works with CAS Dean’s Office and Provost Office to ensure that the Department is fully aligned with University initiatives, policies, and goals.
	+ Manages and coordinates supply requests and replenishments for the Chemistry office supply stockroom. Prepares carts for processing by Business Manager.
	+ Provides logistical support and assistance to faculty, staff, students, and external clients with routine office-related questions.
* Other duties or projects as assigned appropriate to rank and departmental mission.

  


**Special Notes**:  

This is a full-time appointment. FLSA Non Exempt position, eligible for the overtime provisions of the FLSA.  

  

In addition to the employee's base salary, this position is eligible for $3,400 UUP annual location pay, paid biweekly.  

  

For this position, we are unable to sponsor candidates for work visas.

title: Surgical Pathology Laboratory Lead Manager
description:
**Surgical Pathology Laboratory Lead Manager**

  

**Position Summary**



This position reports to the Senior Academic Administrator for Anatomic Pathology and is technically supervised by the Vice-Chair of Anatomic Pathology. This position interacts with Stony Brook University Hospital leadership and external regulatory agencies.

  


**Duties of the Surgical Pathology Lead Manager**


* Partner with the Senior Administrator and the Vice Chair for Anatomic Pathology to recruit histology laboratory staff and Pathology Assistants.
* Conduct annual staff evaluations and oversee laboratory staff scheduling to ensure optimal diagnostic services, in compliance with University Hospital Policies and Procedures. Oversee technical staff and work-flow. Ensure participation in national technical staff competency programs, as mandated by the NY State Department of Health, CLEP, CAP and JCAHO standards. Maintain updated procedure manuals based on regulatory agency standards and University Hospital policies. Participate in corrective actions as directed by SBUH policies.
* Ensure the security of the supply chain for equipment and supplies.
* Meet the needs of changing or emerging services in Surgical Pathology. Oversee immunohistochemistry procedures and deploy solutions to process tissues for electron microscopy.
* Interface with the Anatomic Pathology LIS Coordinator and ensure efficient workflow through LIS training of technical staff.
* Support the Vice Chair for Quality Improvement for data collection for the AP QA and QI programs.
* Train technical staff, medical students, and residents to process surgical pathology specimens. Develop and participate in continuing education and in-service education.
* Participate in Corporate Compliance Plan.
* Ensure that policies, standards, and environmental monitors are in compliance with requirements of the SBU Office of Health and Safety. Communicate results of environmental safety monitors to laboratory staff, the Directors of Surgical Pathology and the Residency Program, and to the Senior Departmental Administrator for Anatomic Pathology.
* Address Facilities and Housekeeping issues.

  


**Qualifications**


**Required****:**


* BS Degree in Medical Technology or one of the biological sciences is required. In lieu of a BS degree in Medical Technology or a biological science, an additional 8 years of experience is required.
* Certification as a NY State Education Department Clinical Laboratory Technologist
* At least 6 years of work experience working in a Surgical Pathology/Histology Laboratory.
* Experience in utilization of a Laboratory Information System to optimize Histology Laboratory operations.
* Experience in data generation and analysis for Quality Assurance and Quality Improvement.
* Experience with laboratory bar coding and tracking programs.


**Preferred:**


* Masters Degree.
* Experience in a teaching hospital laboratory environment.
* 2 years supervisory experience in the specialty area of Histology.

  



**Special Notes****:** **Resume/CV should be included with the online application.**


**Posting Overview****:** This position will remain posted until filled or for a maximum of 90 days. An initial review of all applicants will occur two weeks from the posting date. Candidates are advised on the application that for full consideration, applications must be received before the initial review date (which is within two weeks of the posting date).



If within the initial review no candidate was selected to fill the position posted, additional applications will be considered for the posted position; however, the posting will close once a finalist is identified, and at minimal, two weeks after the initial posting date. Please note, that if no candidate were identified and hired within 90 days from initial posting, the posting would close for review, and possibly reposted at a later date.

title: Disassembly & Reassembly Technician
description:
Are you a highly motivated and reliable Assembly Technician? Are you looking for a collision repair company that values People and Processes while working alongside those with a Passion for auto repair? This is your opportunity!  

If you are tired of the mediocre shop, allow us to take you out of the average and put you into the future of the collision repair business.


Each teammate is a valued part of the repair process. We support each team member with the tools and support needed to succeed: state-of-the-art collision repair equipment, tools and all the training you can handle. You will expand your skills while being paid!


What’s in it for you?* Medical, Dental, and vision insurance for you and your family (including domestic partners)
* $50,000 employer-paid life insurance policy
* 401K plan with an employer match
* Employee Assistance Program includes confidential assistance in the following areas
* Counseling from relationships to stress and substance abuse
* Work/Life benefits, including personal, financial, and legal issues
* Self-Help benefits
* Peak performance coaching
* Lifestyle saving benefits for wellness, shopping, travel
* Personal development and training
* Heath savings account to assist with medical bills
* Paid time off to promote work-life balance
* **8** **paid holidays****,** **including Black Friday****,** **and get your Birthday as a floating holiday!**
* Growth opportunities within our company
* Paid training including industry certifications, I-Car & OEM
 *The specific pay rate/salary offered to a candidate may be influenced by several factors including experience, education, specialized certifications from OEMs, and where the job is* *located**.*

  

Technician Specific Benefits* Shop equipped with the newest technology and equipment
* Uniforms provided
* Work environment OSHA certified to current quality standards
* Market competitive wages and pay structures
  

The Disassembly & Reassembly Technician is responsible for disassembling, inspecting, and assessing vehicles for additional or hidden damage. Once the vehicle is ready, the technician will reassemble the vehicle.  

Job Requirements:* Follow the company blueprinting process and disassembly procedures (DFR) for all vehicle inspections
* Disassemble vehicles after the initial estimate, inspect all vehicles for internal structure and parts from the initial inspection (estimate), and identify additional damage
* Complete disassembly of the vehicle to assist estimators in assessing damage to prepare a 100% repair plan
* Document and record additional damage and required parts on a damage report (including blend panels, small parts, on-time use fasteners, moldings, etc.).
* Notify the production manager/estimator regarding supplements based on additional damage/parts discovered
* Assist the metal technician with reassembly upon completion of the repair, as needed
* Perform light non-structural repairs – light finishing, sanding, minor bumper repairs, etc.
* Reassemble vehicle – replace final moldings, trim, and detail pieces
* Perform assigned duties safely and responsibly that does not expose yourself or other employees to unnecessary risk of injury
* Other duties as assigned
  

Skills, Qualifications & Requirements:* At least one year of auto body repair experience
* Must be at least 18 years of age
* HS Diploma or GED, Auto Body Vo-Tech certification strongly preferred
* Ability to effectively communicate with others
* Ability to read and understand basic instructions, written estimates, and work orders
* Multi-tasking; adapt easily to fast-paced environments
  

Physical Requirements:* Ability to stoop, bend, squat, kneel and pull
* Extended periods of kneeling, bending, squatting, and stooping to complete or inspect repairs

title: Clinical Pharmacy Technician - Bilingual English/Russian
description:
**Job Summary**

To ensure the safety, efficacy, and affordability of medications prescribed by providers.

**Description of the duties and responsibilities**

Pharmacy technicians are responsible for performing the technical tasks involved with the storage and distribution medication samples to patients during visits.

Communicate with pharmaceutical representatives to maintain medication samples and reordering.

Assists providers in reviewing and refiling medications, maintaining the drug inventory and patient records, and completing required documentation of tasks.

Facilitates prior authorizations and medications changes with the pharmacy and provider to ensure medication affordability for the patient.

Works under the direct supervision of the pharmacist and/or provider to educate patients on the importance of medication compliance and assist providers in medication reconciliation.

Positions available include full-time position. Shifts available include: 9A - 5P and 10A - 6P, hours may be flexible.

**Required qualifications** 

Knowledge Qualifications:

* Excellent working knowledge of drug names, dosages, and dosage forms.
* Knowledge of computer applications such as Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, Calendar) is preferred.
* Understanding of medication sig abbreviations and drug interactions
* Rotate a Saturday schedule every 4 weeks.

Skill and Ability Qualifications:

* Time management
* Detail orientated
* Personable
* Composure
* Professional

Preferred Qualifications:

* Work requires a High School diploma or equivalent and pharmacy experience is required.
* Registration by the Board of Pharmacy as a Registered Pharmacy Technician is required.
* New hires have 3 months from date of hire to obtain registration.
* PTCB certification is preferred but not required.

title: Byram Healthcare: Junior Web Developer
description:
At Owens & Minor, we are a critical part of the healthcare process. As a Fortune 500 company with 50+ facilities across the US and 18,000 teammates in over 90 countries, we provide integrated technologies, products and services across the full continuum of care. Customers—and their patients—are at the heart of what we do.


Our mission is to empower our customers to advance healthcare, and our success starts with our teammates.


Owens & Minor teammate benefits include:

* Medical, dental, and vision insurance, available on first working day
* 401(k), eligibility after 30 days of employment
* Employee stock purchase plan
* Tuition reimbursement
* Development opportunities to grow your career with a global company

**POSITION SUMMARY**


Design, code and implement highly interactive website landing pages for advertising campaigns, lead generation forms, microsites, user experience functionality, and email automation templates for transactional emails. Strong command of software programming for desktop and mobile, a solid understanding of component-based development, modern front-end frameworks, responsive design, web accessibility, and an understanding of back-end development. This is an important role within digital marketing to enhance Byram’s online and mobile customer experiences to attract, convert and retain customers.

***Please note this is a hybrid work environment in our White Plains NY office. The expected salary range for this position is $60,000 - $90,000 per year and will be based on years of experience.***

**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:**

* Design, code, and implement new user experience functionality for websites, mobile apps, and other digital and social media properties.
* Develop responsive cross-browser website components, landing pages for paid search, display ads, on-site manufacturer media ads, microsites, lead generation and order intake forms.
* Collaborate cross functionally to translate business requirements into innovative website and online user experiences.
* Provide programming support for automated transactional email templates, email marketing campaigns and automation of web metrics reporting for marketing programs, including technical search engine optimization revisions.
* Manage testing and integration of 3rd party JavaScript code for user experience tools - online surveys, call tracking, multivariate testing, customer & product reviews, customer data platform, and web accessibility.
* Wireframe and mockup new landing pages, website sections, CMS components and other user experience design changes.
* Implement new banners, videos, content pages, blog articles, and other digital assets for the websites.
* Support user acceptance testing for functionality changes within Test and Production environments.
* Integrate AI and machine learning algorithms to enhance user personalization, improve website functionality, and automate routine tasks.

**EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:**

* Bachelor’s degree in digital marketing, computer science or related field.
* ***Minimum 2 years of experience in modern front-end design, development, and deployment for mobile and desktop.***
* Experience transforming business requirements into wireframes/design comps, reusable and accessible components, and engaging and professional website and mobile user experiences that attract, convert and retain customers.
* Proven design and coding experience in front-end web development for B2B, B2C, e-commerce or lead generation.
* Advanced experience in HTML5, JavaScript, CSS3, and Bootstrap.
* Strong programming skills with JavaScript frameworks such as React, Vue, Angular, Alertify, JQuery and Backbone.js.
* Experience with modern JavaScript libraries and tools, such as Redux, Next.js, and TypeScript.
* Knowledge of AI frameworks and tools like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or OpenAI APIs to integrate intelligent features.
* Experience consuming RESTful web services via AJAX; experience with JSON.
* Understanding of UX and UI design with an emphasis on maximizing usability.
* Working understanding of responsive design and other modern web techniques.
* In-depth experience with Chrome Developer Tools (or similar) for debugging front-end web applications.
* Good understanding of SEO principles.
* Experience managing, maintaining, and extending a CMS.
* Experience with desktop design programs - Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, etc.)
* Working knowledge of code versioning tools such as Git or SVN.
* Comfortable designing and coding within content management systems such as Sitecore, Drupal and Adobe Experience Manager
* Ability to domestically travel up to 10%
* Ability to work various shifts.
* May work extended hours on occasion.


If you feel this opportunity could be the next step in your career, we encourage you to apply. This position will accept applications on an ongoing basis.


Owens & Minor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, genetic information, religion, disability, age, status as a veteran, or any other status prohibited by applicable national, federal, state or local law.

title: Solution Consultant – Kronos
description:
**Job Summary:**

The client is seeking an experienced Kronos Techno-Functional Consultant to support the consolidation of five existing Kronos Workforce Central (WFC) instances into a unified UKG Pro Workforce Management (ProWFM) system. The consultant will report to Kronos Upgrade Program Manager and will work closely with various client agencies, including NYCT, B&T, MTA Bus, LIRR, and MNR, to understand business processes, map them into technical specifications, and develop scripts that align with organizational needs. This role requires hands-on experience in both technical and functional aspects of Kronos WFC and ProWFM, including deep expertise in SQL, PeopleSoft HRMS integrations, and advanced scheduling.

**Key Responsibilities:**

· Business Process Analysis: Collaborate with agency stakeholders to understand existing business processes and translate them into technical requirements for ProWFM.

· Technical Specifications & Scripting: Develop technical specifications, SQL queries, and stored procedures to support the migration from WFC to ProWFM. Perform code reviews and fine-tune SQL code to ensure optimal performance.

· Customization of Pay & Work Rules: Customize pay rules and create tailored work rules to fit each transfer scenario, ensuring alignment with MTA’s operational needs.

· Accruals Configuration: Configure and customize accruals, including dates, date patterns, limits, grants, balance cascades, probation periods, and accrual policies, to meet specific business requirements.

· Advanced Scheduling: Implement and manage advanced scheduling features within ProWFM, ensuring proper configuration and functionality across different teams.

· Integration with PeopleSoft HRMS: Design and implement integrations with PeopleSoft HRMS to support seamless payroll processing. Ensure that all interfaces are robust and meet MTA’s operational needs.

· API & 3rd Party Interfaces: Develop and manage APIs and other interfaces to integrate Kronos with third-party applications, ensuring data accuracy and system reliability.

· CBA (Collective Bargaining Agreement) Compliance: Work with stakeholders to ensure that all system configurations and processes comply with applicable CBAs.

· Migration & Integration: Actively participate in the migration process, including transitioning from Central to Dimensions, and implementing WIM to Boomi interfaces.

· Report Conversion & Development: Assist in converting existing Workforce reports to ProWFM and design new reports based on evolving business requirements.

· Interface Testing: Develop and execute interface test scripts; support the business in conducting end-to-end process testing in ProWFM.

· **UKG ProWFM Updates**: Continuously monitor and implement the latest updates released from UKG for ProWFM, ensuring that the system is up-to-date with the latest features and improvements.

· **Collaboration**: Work closely with the System Integrator and PMO to ensure a smooth and successful system upgrade.

· Documentation & Training: Provide detailed documentation of processes and offer training to business users as needed.

**Qualifications:**

· Minimum 7-10 plus years of hands-on experience with Kronos WFC and UKG ProWFM.  
Technical Expertise: Strong technical knowledge in Kronos WFC, ProWFM, SQL queries, stored procedures, code reviews, fine-tuning SQL code, PeopleSoft HRMS, API development, 3rd party interfaces, WIM, Boomi Interfaces, and SDLC methodologies.

· Functional Expertise: Proven ability to understand and map complex business processes into technical solutions, with a focus on compliance with Collective Bargaining Agreements (CBAs).

· Customization Skills: Experience in customizing pay rules, creating tailored work rules, and configuring accruals within ProWFM.

· Understand and configure software interfacing products, Perform business rule analysis.  
Configure software applications, Understand and configure software interfacing products.

· Follow practices and procedures in analyzing a variety of business situations or data requiring a review of a variety of factors.

· Provide knowledge transfer for customers.

· Advise customers on system configuration, industry specific features and system processes and procedures.

· Research application questions, assist with setting up testing scenarios and provide testing support to the customer team.

· PeopleSoft HRMS Integration: Experience in integrating Kronos with PeopleSoft HRMS for payroll processing.  
Problem Solving: Demonstrated experience in troubleshooting and resolving technical issues during system upgrades.

· Communication: Excellent communication skills with the ability to liaise effectively with business users, technical teams, and external vendors.

· Project Management: Familiarity with project management principles and experience working in a PMO environment is a plus.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $100.00 - $105.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Kronos: 10 years (Required)
* UKG Pro Workforce Management: 10 years (Required)
* SQL: 1 year (Required)
* PeopleSoft: 10 years (Required)

Location:

* New York, NY 10004 (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in New York, NY 10004

title: Customer Care Coordinator
description:
101462
9 Middlebury Boulevard, Randolph, New Jersey 07869*TruGreen* *accepts applications on an ongoing basis.*

**Job Description**
-------------------


TruGreen is committed to providing personalized attention for our associates. We focus on developing our people by building proud, dynamic teams while helping associates reach their personal and professional goals. We continuously strive to make TruGreen an employer of choice and "a great place to work!"

**Position Overview:**


Receives inbound and makes outbound calls to resolve customer concerns in a timely and professional manner. Coordinates and resolves customer follow-up requests (CFRs) as a liaison between branches and customers to provide and maintain the highest level of customer service.

**Responsibilities:**

* Receives inbound and makes outbound calls to resolve routine customer concerns (e.g., service, billing, results) in a timely and professional manner. May deviate from routine procedures to diagnose root cause of more complex customer issues.
* Coordinates and resolves customer follow-up requests as a liaison between branches and customers to provide and maintain the highest level of customer service.
* Prioritizes open, overdue and/or critical CFRs or customer concerns and escalates to management as needed.
* Reviews and responds to customer feedback collected through external sources. Compiles statistical data (e.g., net promoter scores, or NPS), identifies trends, and reports to management team.
* Makes contact with cancel request customers to retain business. Probes to identify root cause and uses approved customer save offers (e.g., discounts, service calls) to retain customer.
* May complete special projects to support branch operations and efficiency
* Enters and maintains customer data (e.g., contact information, service plan, billing information) into customer database accurately and timely.
* Researches customer database for account and service history and information to resolve customer concerns.
* Follows standard policies, procedures and scripting when interacting with and resolving customer concerns to ensure quality outcomes.
* May assess customer needs for additional services and up-sell as appropriate.
* Identifies and communicates improvement opportunities or trends impacting the customer experience to management.
* May receive customers and vendors at assigned branch.

**Education and Experience Requirements:**

* High school diploma/GED required. Associate’s degree preferred.
* 2-3 years of customer service experience required
* Experience resolving escalated customer service issues required
* Computer skills with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)

**Physical Demands & Working Conditions:**


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Regularly required to:

* Sit, stand and walk
* Use hands and arms to handle, feel or reach
* Speak and hear
* Use close vision abilities


Occasionally required to:

* Lift or move up to 25 lbs
* Stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl


The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.


Noise level:

* Low to moderate


Adverse Conditions:

* Minimal


Ability to speak, read and write fluently in English is required.


You MUST BE physically located in the United States while performing this job.

*TruGreen is proud to affirm our commitment to hiring veterans. We recognize and appreciate the exceptional skills, dedication, and leadership that veterans bring to the workforce. By fostering an inclusive and diverse environment, we aim to leverage the unique experiences of veterans, creating a richer, more dynamic workplace.*

**Pay Ranges**
==============


$36,592.00 - $65,865.00
This range is based on the qualifications necessary for the position, including experience, training, and other considerations permitted by law. Factors that may be used when making an offer may include a candidate’s skills, experience, and geographic location, the expected quality and quantity of work, and internal pay alignment, as needed. Most candidates will start in the bottom half of the pay range. The upper end of the range will generally be reserved for candidates with extensive experience. An employee’s pay history will not be a contributing factor where prohibited by local law. In addition to monetary compensation, we offer benefits, including Medical/Dental/Vision insurance and Company-matching 401(k) in addition to other programs and perks.


TruGreen is committed to Diversity and Inclusion. We encourage diverse candidates to apply to this position.  

  

We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer - Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities. To learn more, please visit EEOC/EEO | TruGreen (trugreenjobs.com).  

  

California Residents: When you express interest in or apply for a job with TruGreen Limited Partnership, we collect personal information about you, potentially including personal identifiers, contact information, protected classifications, pre-hire information, professional or employment-related information, education history, and/or medical information, for the following business purposes: to comply with state and federal law and regulations requiring employers to maintain certain records; to evaluate your job application and candidacy for employment; and to obtain and verify background checks (including criminal and motor vehicle records), pre-employment drug testing, and references.  

  

TruGreen performs pre-employment testing.  

  

To view our disclaimer, https://trugreenjobs.com/us/en/disclaimer

 **Flik Independent School Dining** has been leading the way in transforming private and independent school foodservice across 300 communities for over four decades. But we don't stop at just foodservice – we take it to the next level by offering cutting-edge nutrition education programs that empower students to make smart, healthy choices daily. ---------------

* Ensures proper presentation, portion control and maintenance of serving temperatures; follows HACCP standards.
* Maintains sanitation and orderliness of all equipment, supplies and utensils.
* Ensures proper food preparation by following approved recipes and production standards.
Performs other duties as assigned.  
*

title: Installation Support Technician (Cabling Experience Required)
description:
Temporary for 20.60 weeks of work starting on 9/23/2024.

Job Type: Full-Time/Contract

Job Summary: We are seeking a reliable and skilled Installation Support Technician with experience in cabling and basic IT support tasks. The ideal candidate will be responsible for installing and troubleshooting network/PC infrastructure, including running CAT 5 and CAT 6 cables, drilling and mounting speakers, and installing network components. This position requires working on ladders and providing your own tools.

Key Responsibilities:

* Cabling: Run, terminate, and test CAT 5 and CAT 6 cables according to industry standards.
* Hardware Installation: Install and configure network and PC type hardware.
* Drilling and Mounting: Drill and securely mount speakers and other equipment as required.
* Ladder Work: Safely work on ladders to install and maintain equipment at heights.
* Basic IT Support: Provide hands-on support for hardware troubleshooting, replacements, and other support tasks as needed.
* Documentation: Maintain accurate records of work performed, including cable runs, installations, and troubleshooting steps.
* Safety Compliance: Follow all safety protocols and procedures to ensure a safe working environment.

Qualifications:

* Experience: Proven experience in running CAT 5 and CAT 6 cables, and installing network hardware.
* Tools: Must provide own tools.
* Physical Requirements: Ability to work on ladders and over head
* Technical Skills: Basic understanding of network and PC install. Audio experience is helpful.
* Problem-Solving: Strong troubleshooting skills with the ability to work independently and efficiently.
* Communication: Good communication skills to interact with team members and clients.
* Safety Awareness: Knowledge of safety practices related to working with electrical equipment, ladders, and power tools.

Required Tools:

* Ladder capable of reaching 8’ ceilings but as low as 6'.
* Basic hand tools
* Smart phone
* Flash light – not the one on the phone
* Glow sticks
* Fish tape
* Electrical tape
* Impact driver
* Cordless drill
* Various sizes of wood, metal and masonry drill bits
* Various sizes and types of driver bits
* Ethernet cable tester that displays output of all 8 pins simultaneous
* Cable toner
* 1” spade bit (in addition to the bits mentioned above)
* 1” masonry bit (in addition to the bits mentioned above)
* Velcro

Preferred Qualifications:

* Certifications such as CompTIA Network+, etc
* Previous experience in a similar hands-on IT support role.

Equal Opportunity Employer: Essintial Enterprise Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

Job Types: Contract, Temporary

Pay: $24.00 - $27.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Schedule:

* Day shift

Experience:

* Cabling: 2 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Edison, NJ (Required)

Willingness to travel:

* 75% (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: EB Benefits Analyst lll
description:
**General Description:** Responsible for analyzing information and creating financial deliverables for clients with standard to complex benefit programs. Includes fully insured and self-funded clients. **Responsibilities:*** Responsible for financial analytics for clients that are fully insured and self-funded. Typical client size is 100 to 1,000 lives.
* Prepare standard analyses with occasional customization. Analyses may include:
* Market review analysis
* Renewal rate and funding projections and modeling
* Analysis of claims utilization
* Rate and Contribution analysis
* Claims experience reports
* Benchmarking
* Financial funding analysis
* IBNR and lag analyses
* Develop alternative strategies, plan modeling, and cost reduction opportunities.
* Perform technical analysis of group insurance contracts and financial arrangements.
* Serve as primary contact with insurance carriers. Negotiate and market coverage for new business quotes and renewals. Includes requesting quotes, evaluating options, negotiating rates and benefit features, and preparing renewal/new plan options with executive summary.
* Develop and maintain excellent carrier relationships.
* Review and validate carrier renewal rating illustration.
* Analyze experience and claims utilization data for financial and plan usage conclusions. Includes identifying trends and relationship of experience to renewal rating. With guidance suggest action items.
* Write client facing Executive Summaries that provide observations, conclusions, recommendations, and next steps. With guidance articulate USI strategic objectives.
* Prepare carrier and client written correspondence. Includes carrier renewal confirmation letters and client renewal letters.
* Occasionally conduct analysis using USI internal and third-party external tools. Includes USI 3D, USI Clear Options Rx, and actuarial tools.
* Participate in peer review process as a participant and a reviewer.
* Occasionally participate in new Analyst onboarding training.
* Keep current on industry and new product information, legislation, technology, and trends.

 **Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:*** 3 years + of experience in employee benefits or related field.
* College degree required.
* Must hold or be willing to obtain a state Life & Disability insurance license.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, team environment with minimal instruction.
* Ability to manage and negotiate multiple priorities and deadlines.
* Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills.
* Working knowledge of Microsoft Office products, including Excel and Word.
* Ability to become proficient in internal analytic systems and carrier online reporting tools.
* Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills.
* Ability to carry out complex tasks with many concrete and abstract variables.

  

Comp- 70-73K
**Why USI?**
With more than $2.5 billion in revenue and over 10,000 associates across 200+ offices nationwide, USI is one of the largest insurance brokerage and consulting firms in the world. At USI, we have created one of the most dynamic personal and professional development cultures in the industry. We invest heavily in our associates, and we take pride in celebrating their growth and success through our one-of-a-kind employee reward and recognition programs. We invite you to learn more about what makes USI an exceptional place to work! **Unrivaled Resources and Support**
What truly distinguishes USI as a premier insurance brokerage and consulting firm is the USI ONE Advantage®, a game-changing value proposition that delivers to clients a robust set of risk management and benefit solutions with bottom-line financial impact. USI ONE® represents Omni, Network, Enterprise—the three key elements that set USI apart from the competition. Through USI ONE, we develop strategic, timely and effective risk management and benefit programs in terms that are easy to understand, and we demonstrate how the solutions can have a positive economic impact. **Industry-Leading Programs, Rewards, and Recognition**
In addition to competitive pay, incentives, and benefits, USI recognizes associates through our Summit Awards program, rewarding excellence in those who build our brand each day. USI offers employee programs that recognize outstanding achievement and help our associates lead healthy, productive lives. We turn care into action with our award-winning wellness program, college scholarships for associates' children, and financial help in times of need. **Deep Community Engagement**
We are committed to giving back to our local communities and supporting a culture of environmental sustainability. From sharing our time, talent, and resources to support local non-profit organizations, animal shelters, and environmental beautification and restoration projects – to partnering with eco-conscious vendors and taking steps to reduce our own environmental footprint – we’re working together as ONE to build a better future. **Committed to a Diverse, Equitable, and Inclusive Workplace**
Our award-winning I’m With U diversity, equity, and inclusion program educated our associates to help them better understand and serve our clients, prospects, fellow team members, and local communities through curated education and training resources, employee support programs, and community outreach initiatives to build a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. **Nationally Recognized as a Top Insurance Employer*** Recognized as one of Insurance Business America’s Top Insurance Employers for six consecutive years (2018-2023).
* Named to Business Insurance’s annual list of the Best Places to Work in Insurance four years in a row (2020-2023).
* Recipient of the American Heart Association’s Gold Status for a maintaining a culture of health and well-being five years in a row (2018-2022).
* Visit our Awards and Accolades page for a complete list of industry awards and recognitions!
  


*USI is committed to providing a full-suite of competitive benefits for our growing population and its diverse needs. We offer a wide range of health, welfare and financial benefits including medical, wellness, dental and vision, 401(k), flexible spending and health savings accounts, short and long-term disability, life insurance and other unique employer-sponsored and voluntary programs. USI also offers a generous paid time off policy, paid family leave benefit as well as paid holiday time**.*

  

$70,000-$73,000

title: School Computer Technology Specialist - L1 (26Q430)
company: New York City Department of Education
description:
**Position Type:**  

  

Annual School Based

  

  

  

**Office Title/Functional Title:**  

  

School Computer Technology Specialist - L1 (26Q430) - 23830

  

  

**Civil Service Title:**  

  

School Computer Technology Specialist (DOE)

  

  

  

**Level:**  

  

L1

  

  

  

**Division/Office:**  

  

Division of School Leadership

  

  

  

**Borough:**
  

Queens
  

  

**Posting End Date:**
  

09/05/2024  

  

  

This position is in a civil service competitive class that is subject to examination. Position is only open to current City employees with permanent NYC civil service status as **School Computer Technology Specialist** or permanent in an equivalent title that is eligible for transfer under 6.1.9 to **School Computer Technology Specialist**. This position is open to qualified persons with a disability who are eligible for the 55-a program. Please indicate in your cover letter that you would like to be considered for the position under the 55-a program.

  

  

  

**Description:**  

  

**Position Summary:** The School Computer Technology Specialist will provide hardware, software and network support services to the school and staff. To work effectively in this capacity, the School Computer Technology Specialist must maintain good communication with school staff, students and their families, vendors, and partnering organizations as needed. Performs related work.  


**Reports to: School** Principal  


**Key Relationships:** Works closely with school administrators and instructional staff to ensure that computer operations and technical services align with instructional needs. Interfaces with technical support staff located at the Division of Instructional and Information Technology on an as needed basis.  


**Responsibilities**  


* Provides technical expertise to maintain electronic devices currently in the school including: computers, servers, printers, SMART Boards, and all other electronic peripheral devices.
* Maintains, organizes and troubleshoots all computers, including those in administrative offices, classrooms, computer labs, laptop carts and Teacher Center.
* Installs new software, sets up networks, maintains new hardware and repairs and/or replaces faulty equipment.
* Responsible for all aspects of the design and installation of new computer labs.
* Maintains, organizes and troubleshoots the instructional server, including maintaining hardware and performing systems and diagnostic checks.
* Configures Outlook and DOE software and hardware.
* Maintains staff and student user accounts; adds new Outlook accounts for administrative and instructional clients.
* Schedules, supervises and performs hardware maintenance tasks, such as re-imaging hard drives, repairing hardware and removing viruses.
* Conducts routine service functions in maintaining, troubleshooting, repairing or replacing component parts in school computers on-site.
* Installs instructional and office support computer software.
* Oversees installation of software, maintenance and upgrades of all technology.
* Serves as the primary contact regarding all Career and Technical Education software installation and troubleshoots issues arising during Certiport, NOCTI, Inventor, MAYA, and PTLW certification examinations.
* Oversees all technology requirements for administration of Advanced Placement Examinations.
* Maintains inventory and security of all computers and technology based materials.
* Provides technical expertise to maintain electronic devices currently in the building including computers, servers, printers, scanners and projectors.
* Resolves issues or problems that teachers and students have with computer hardware, printer or software applications in technology and engineering classes.
* Resolves issues with all electronic devices in the school building.
* Initiates tickets to the central help desk for hardware problems and assists support personnel with resolution of problems at the school level.
* Assists members of the school Student Mouse Squad

  


**Qualifications**  


**Minimum Requirements**  



* A four‐year high school diploma or its educational equivalent approved by a State’s department of education or a recognized accrediting organization and one year of satisfactory full‐time experience in computer maintenance or repair, mainframe, server and/or mini computer operations, software or technical support; or


* Education and/or experience equivalent to “1” above. However, all candidates must have a four‐year high school diploma or its educational equivalent. Education above the high school level may be substituted for experience described in “1” above at a rate of 30 semester credits from an accredited college or university, including or supplemented by 6 semester credits in mainframe, server and/or mini computer operations or a computer related field of study, for six months of experience. Graduation from an approved technical school with at least 450 hours in a specialization in mainframe, server or mini computer operations or a certified technical training program in computer maintenance and repair may be substituted for up to three months of the experience described in “1” above.
  


**Preferred**
* Advanced coursework in computer systems, networking and applications across MAC and PC platforms.
* Experience working in a school environment with computer networks such as STARS, ATS, CAP and related computer applications.
* Experience with maintaining and troubleshooting networks**.**
* Satisfactory record of attendance and punctuality.
* Ability to work with students, parents, teachers, community liaisons, partner organizations and supervisors.
* Knowledge of school program objectives.
* Ability to develop excellent interpersonal relationships
* Demonstrates positive and effective written and oral communication skills
  


**Salary**:



$46,139 (New Hire Rate)

$52,695 -$59,721 (Incumbent - 2 years of full-time continuous City service)  



(Internal candidates who are selected for this position and who currently hold comparable or less senior positions within the DOE will not earn less than their current salary.)


**Please include a resume and cover letter with your application.**


**NOTE: The filling of all positions is subject to budget availability and/or grant funding.**


**\\*** **New****York****City****Residency** **is NOT Required \\***


**We encourage all applicants from the** **New****York****City** **tri-state area to apply.**

  

  

  

**AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER**  

  

**DOE Non- Discrimination Policy**  

The Department of Education of the City of New York is an inclusive equal opportunity employer committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse workforce and providing a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment upon any legally protected status or protected characteristic, including but not limited to an individual's actual or perceived sex, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or pregnancy. For more information, please refer to the DOE Non-Discrimination Policy.

  

  

**Public Service Loan Forgiveness**
  

As a prospective employee of the City of New York, you may be eligible for federal loan forgiveness programs and state repayment assistance programs.
